Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nazish H
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing. It is located in the center of St. Germain where all the cafes and restaurants are open till late. It is a lively area with lots of young people. The metro is a 2 minute walk which makes life very easy! There are lots of shops around as well. The hotel itself seems very classy when you first walk in. They have nice couches and a fireplace. The room was a bit tiny which was expected. This hotel had a very classic touch to it. Everything was good except the bed in room #14 seems to have run out of life and needs replacing. Other than that, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “High comfort with great character”
Reviews.Author: MrEccles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed twice at this lovely boutique hotel near St Sulpice and we plan to visit again later this year. We have tried larger hotels and smaller in Paris, but none achieves that quiet blend of gentle understatement and sophistication to be found here. Rooms can be compact - and because of the great age of the building, quirky in shape - but comfort is high and the muted decor induces a sense of relaxation. Service is crisp and urbane and the default welcome is a smile, not always the case in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sabbaticaltravel
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Hotel Odeon in a charming larger room facing the street, and then 1 more night later in the trip in a smaller room facing the back. The staff is wonderfully helpful, multilingual, and have good suggestions for restaurants and bars. There is a small lift, but the stairs aren't too onerous. If you are staying more than one night, definitely upgrade to the larger room. Nice products in bathroom, good sheets/bed, free wifi, a few blocks in either direction to 2 metro stops and surrounded by good cafes and bars. What more can you ask for in Paris?

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: flyinghikoki
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us for 4 nights at the Hotel Odeon St. Germain after much research. We had room #15 on the top floor facing the street which wasn't that noisy. We even had the windows open at night and slept well. I think our room was pretty spacious for the hotel although it has low ceilings so not a room for really tall folks. The staff was amazingly helpful, the location was very central - easy walk to the Metro and everything was within reach - markets, interesting shops, cafes. We didn't eat at the hotel so we can't comment on the breakfast but you'll surely love it!

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel located in the heart of St Germain”
Reviews.Author: Samantha L
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 wonderful evenings at the Odeon. I chose the hotel because of the location and wasn't disappointed at all. Having been to Paris the previous year (also stayed in the 6th but the other end) I knew being near a metro stop was key. I didn't realize how close we would be to everything else. Cafes, shopping, markets, and the candy stand. Perfect. The hotel offered clean, comfortable rooms (we had a deluxe with 2 twin beds forming a king). The room was quiet from the noise on St Sulpice and from the other rooms. People always complain about the size of Paris hotel rooms, I have found them to be larger than rooms in NYC for less money. We had breakfast one morning at the hotel. My only complaint was the coffee. Not as good as you come to expect in Paris. I would not only recommemd this hotel but plan to stay there on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Intimate Boutique, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: acdhuber
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved my stay at Hotel Odeon Saint Germain last month. I was travelling alone, and I wanted a cozy boutique in a fantastic location. I had heard great things about this hotel from friends and family, but the experience truly exceeded my expectations. I had booked a single, and I was upgraded to a double when I arrived, fresh off the plane and hours before the scheduled check in time. The hotel staff was so friendly and accommodating, and on more than one occasion, I heard them offer early arrivals an opportunity to freshen up before their rooms were officially ready. Yes, my room was on the small size; it's Paris. Get over it. The room was well appointed, including a writing desk. The bathroom was small, but the shower was actually very spacious. In the evenings, I took my book and glass of wine down to the lobby where I read by the fire. Utterly charming experience. The location was amazing with an ample supply of restaurants and cafes within easy walking distance. I will absolutely stay at this hotel again, particularly when travelling alone. What a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great area with friendly staff and intimate atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: BarnesMassive
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel in St Germain des Pres. Has a Blake's in London feel to it, cool and understated, in an old building, tastefully restored. It's small and interesting, surprisingly quiet for the location. The rooms are small as you would expect in an old Paris townhouse, but are nicely decorated, the beds and pillows are comfortable, most of the rooms have small showers, a few have baths, with L'Occitane toiletries. Decent minibar in the room. Only complaint - the air conditioning unit wasn't working in our room, though sometimes hotels disconnect these in the winter - you would need this working in the summer as opening the windows isn't an option because of street noise. A limited continental breakfast is served in the hallway just beyond the reception desk, with fresh bread and pastries and quality juices. There is an honesty bar which we loved, and free wifi. Staff were very helpful, something not universal in Paris. All in all, throughly recommend.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “A gem in Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: MMH61
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Odeon for 9 nights in February. This is a great little hotel at an excellent location. The rooms are comfortable, clean and relatively spacious for Paris standards. But what makes this hotel stand out among many similar ones is the staff. I have not experienced such professionalism, attentiveness, efficiency and warmth all at once in staff in any other hotel. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family who travel to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Sebguy
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best boutique hotels in Paris. We know Paris quite well and our experience at the Odeon left us thoroughly impressed The hotel is so charming and well situated (right in the middle of Saint Germain) and extremely good value. The staff were superb. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: STwin
Reviews.Content: Refreshing change from typical hotels - fantastic Paris charm and friendly service. Newly renovated and impeccably clean. Smaller rooms but lacked no amenity. Great experience - would definitely stay here on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Bakkabretti
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain while on a recent business trip to Paris. The location is right in the heart of things and close to the Metro. I intend to return next spring and stay at this Hotel again. Breakfast was great. I found the reception staff very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Stay”
Reviews.Author: 17JAC17
Reviews.Content: I like staying in St. Germain when I come to Paris on business, and have stayed at a different hotel each of the last three times in the past 15 months. I decided to try the Odeon Saint-Germain this time and the stay was mixed. The good: The location can't be beat - right in the heart of things and a short walk to the Metro. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The not so good: The executive room, even by Paris standards in this category, I found to be a little small and the bed was not very comfortable. Two mornings there was no hot water. The breakfast was nothing to write home about. For a hotel that is so highly rated, I was a bit disappointed and don't know if I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel, top location on left bank”
Reviews.Author: bernbe
Reviews.Content: One of my best surprises in Paris. very helpful staff, nice, although small, rooms nice little salon to read a book or prepare for a walk, fruit at the reception had a room in the back, with surprisingly for paris no noise at all! didin't have breakfast here but all seemed conveniently prepared. free wifi excellent location even for right bank, either walk or metro stations nearby

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TonyShields
Reviews.Content: good... great location, clean quiet room. bad... very soft mattress, toilet very very small, if the shower curtain was 6 inches longer the bathroom floor wouldn't flood every time I showered... the obvious angling of the shower head doesn't work. Indifferent... breakfast was ok, nice coffee. The area is very nice, plenty of good restaurants and some very nice shops. A good base to explore Paris The hotel was ok. Would I stay there again... perhaps.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service - Fantastic locations - Comfortable surroundings”
Reviews.Author: beefoe
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing experience at this hotel, even though it didn't start out that way. Accidentally booked a single room while traveling with my wife. (Single rooms in Europe fit only one person) Despite the hotel being basically completely booked, the staff were able to work things out in a very reasonable fashion. It also gave me the opportunity to see three rooms in one visit. I've stayed at many hotels in Paris and they all have small rooms and bathrooms. It's just the way things are there so don't go expecting you'll have some huge room like you'd get at say the Indianapolis Marriott. What you want are clean, comfortable rooms with decent bathrooms and nicely appointed common areas. This hotel has all these things but much more. I should also mention that my wife was very happy that the bathroom "products" were all l'occitaine. We stayed in what they call an executive suite one night, which was on the smallish side, but comfortable. The only issue was that rooms 29 and 30 are next to the breakfast and lounge area so there was some noise at night, but didn't notice much in the morning. We then moved to the junior suite, which was very nice, on the top floor with sort of a separate sitting area. Very comfy room with exposed beam ceiling. Common areas were very comfortable with an asian-influenced, but very Parisian decor. The breakfast was quite good with excellent bread and good coffee and croissants. I would also recommend a visit to Carton bakery, which is nearby and has perfect croissants. And of course you are in an area with hundreds of places to eat, but chocolates, drink, etc. all within a ten minute walk. The best thing of all about the hotel was the staff. The manager always seemed to be there and the staff were amazingly accommodating. They went out of their way to ensure that we had a great stay. One simple example was that my wife mentioned she liked one of the songs on the CD player, but couldn’t remember which one. The manager got all the CDs out and had my wife look through them. When that didn’t work, he gave her the remote so she could scan through all eight CDs to see if she could find the song. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: eurydicehk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during Xmas. We liked it immediately upon arrival. The reception area is small, with a separate seating area with a fireplace (which is really inviting on a winter night). The breakfast/drinks area is on ground floor with similarly nice furnishings. The standard double we had was small but charming. Some wear and tear is noticed on the wallpaper and carpet edges, which is not surprising due to the small size of the room and suitcases cannot open completely flat on floor. Some old stains around edges of shower. Overall room is clean and of reasonable repair, quiet (ours faced the courtyard), and bed is comfortable. Only downside is no tea making facilities and the lighting is a bit dark. Our room was at the back, had to climb a short flight of stairs before reaching lift. Lift was smallest I have seen, my husband and I (both Asians of average build) could barely fit in the lift, but we had a good laugh over it. The lift to the front would be of larger size. The front desk staff will happily bring your luggage up and down the room, and to the taxi past the few steps outside the hotel entrance so do call to ask. I would definitely consider going back to this charming place.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: uksteveb
Reviews.Content: Charming little hotel with very friendly and attentive staff. Ideally situated with all the major sites a short walk away. Rooms are certainly adaquate and not uncomfortable. Also if coming from the airport a simple walk (with luggage) from a direct railway station, although it is a commuter train when we arrived in the am it can get packed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Yassin T
Reviews.Content: Great Price/quality ratio in the great Saint-Germain des Pres neighborhood. Small but pleasant, quiet and a great service and staff on top of all that. We had the a nice surprise of being upgraded to a junior suite. The only downside of our stay was the bad smell coming for the Hamam that was installed in our room, but this had not ruined our stay in any manner. We will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Chic”
Reviews.Author: Locumdoc55
Reviews.Content: Great little boutique hotel on the Rue St Sulpice, just up the road from the church made famous by the Da Vinci Code film. Close-by a great little indoor market which sells wonderful cheeses and wines and literally hundreds of restaurants within walking distance. Staff were always helpful and friendly and they upgraded our room because of my wife's problem with stairs. Room was clean and well furnished. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and would go back

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in smallish room”
Reviews.Author: ctg004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with 3 friends sharing one room. Hotelroom itself was lovely although it was a bit small. There was not a lot of room to move around, but the beds were great and the room had a nice atmosphere. Bathroom was also small, but with nice L'Occitane soaps and shampoos and with very good water pressure. The location of the hotel is excellent. There are a lot of nice restaurants and shops nearby and it is also close to the metro. The regular price for the hotel (around EUR 350,- for a room for 3 persons) is definitely too high, but we had a good offer of EUR 219,- per room per night, which I thought was excellent value for money. The lounge is lovely with a fireplace and you can enjoy a cup of tea or a glass of champagne there. Our room was at the front of the hotel and I was a bit apprehensive about the possible noice coming from the streets, but there was hardly any noice so we slept fantastic. Staff was friendly and nice. I would definitely come back but probably with friends and/or husband. I would probably not come her with children as there a no tea making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: WootTravel
Reviews.Content: If you want a true Parisian experience in a hotel where service is a priority, Hotel Odeon is for you. This hotel did not disappoint, the rooms are a decent size, well equipped and comfortable. It has the perfect amount of charm and originality to make it stand out. I have traveled in Europe a bit and this room and hotel ranks high compared to relative sizes and service. The best thing is that it was very quiet but yet close to the fabulous action in the St. Germain area. As most hotels in Europe go, the elevator is tiny and the stairs narrow but it is also what lends itself to the charm of the hotel and was certainly the "norm" as far as most European hotels I have stayed in. The staff was friendly, helpful and responsive. I give this hotel VERY high marks and it was the foundation of an amazing Paris experience!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Parisian Boutique Hotel is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: pmac1238
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was small, in the Latin Quarter and it looked to have classic Parisian style. The hotel is cozy and warm, the staff very friendly, the breakfast, which we had twice, was good with a variety of choices to suite everyone. The location can't be beat - so close to everything but tucked away on a relatively quiet side street. Wonderful bakeries, cafes, and restaurants are within a couple of blocks. The room was lovely and comfortable as was the bathroom, although only one could fit in at a time. This hotel would not be suitable for anyone with physical disabilities.

Reviews.Title: “Could do MUCH Better and not at all 4*”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Odeon on business earlier this week. Looked great in the pictures and after reading some good reviews on tripadvisor I was persuaded to book. On the plus side it is located in the heart of Saint Germain, my favourite district of Paris and it could be described as 'Quaint' to all of you Americans reading this review. On the down-side, the rooms are not as spacious as they appear in the photo's; high ceilings yes, but at ground level they are pokey to say the least in typical Parisian style. No bath tub, just a shower with a curtain which seems to be attracted to your skin at every turn, which can be annoying when trying to apply soap. Toilet space in a recess where your elbows touch both walls although they do put some decent, free (small) shower gel, shampoo and soap to try to make up for this. Elevator (Lift) impossible to get yourself and a suitcase in, and if, like me they stick you at the back of the house, you have to climb two flights of very narrow stairs with your suitcase before you can use the lift! Worst part of my stay was the hotel's 'Room service' or lack of it. to achieve it '4 stars' it has to provide 'room service'. Which it does to a fashion, a 6 item menu consisting of all ready made microwave meals! and yes they are, as the guy on the front desk said, " we have to provide food, so we do provide food, nobody said that it has to be any good!" Only in Paris...He then said, "you should go to the Italian restaurant on the corner" Which I did and was served the worst bowl of pasta and wine I have ever tasted...so avoid the Italian place on the corner if I were you (They also charged me €29 for a glass of cheap house red and a bowl of pasta). Love Saint-Germain but my search for a decent place to stay there continues...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: runway
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean, typically Paris size, the staff was friendly, the location was great, the bathroom was just a little small, but we had a great time. We thought we would use the gathering rooms in the lobby but we were just too busy but they were warm and inviting. Lots of great places to shop and eat very nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, Service, and Location”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: This petit boutique hotel in the 6th (fully renovated), just down the street from St Suplice, is ideally placed for walking to many of the sights and other delights in Paris. Even if it weren’t so well-placed, the service makes it worth a stay. The front desk staff is warm, welcoming, and patient with badly-spoken French (even though their English is so much better than my fractured French). They are knowledgeable and helpful with anything questions you might have. The rooms in the back (30s) are similar in shape and layout, but the other rooms seem to be one of a kind. The rooms are well maintained, quiet (unless you have noisy neighbors), and beautifully appointed, making good use of small spaces. The bathrooms, with l’Occitane toiletries, squeeze functionality and elegance into limited space. The continental breakfast in the downstairs dining area is perfect, especially if it’s included in your room rate. There are only 2 less than positive things I have to say about the rooms: 1) Lighting. This is an old building (perhaps 2 old buildings) and there is limited natural light. The room lighting is OK, but some recessed lighting in the ceiling would be nice, especially if you need to do work. 2) Room size. Part of Hotel Odeon de St Germain’s charm is its petit-ness. This extends to the rooms. Be prepared for “Parisian” spaces. I book a double room just for myself. A week’s worth of luggage and purchases just about fit. I would recommend that couples consider booking a junior suite if you find small spaces annoying. Still, even with those caveats, I keep returning here. I’ve stayed here 5 or 6 times and can’t wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “warm welcome, upscale shopping, cozy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyPatD
Reviews.Content: The heart of Paris, wonderful ambience, this boutique hotel is full of charm, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly and speak English. yes, the room was small, but we opted for the larger bed, (very comfortable) and in fact, we were upgraded, so even w/ 2 rather large suitcases, we were fine. Last year, we stayed in the 9th Ards. and had a huge room in one of the 5 star hotels, but frankly, the coziness, charm, and" location" of Odeon hotel turned out to be preferable. Feels like your own "home away from home".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel in Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: SlumDog99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in Paris over the years and normally switch each visit as my wife and I like to stay in a different are on each visit. We booked the Odeon based on reviews and the location. It is small (39 rooms, I believe) and quite quaint. Rooms are well decorated an the common areas are very tastefully done. Free WiFi is available. There is an honour bar for drinks. Well stocked mini bars in each room. Continental breakfast is available for 14 Euros a night per person. Rooms are small, as per Parisian standards, but still comfortable and well appointed. The overall level of maintenance is quite good. Upon our arrival, we were disappointed to find that the hotel was undergoing some retrofitting work to improve its safety systems and that the work was going on outside our room. Since we had booked only a few days earlier, it clearly was known at the time that the work would be ongoing. After discussion with the manager (who was very understanding about it and who clearly empathized with the problem) we moved to a new (and better) room. Rooms in the back half of the hotel are quieter than the front (away from traffic).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Lilliput”
Reviews.Author: Hambon
Reviews.Content: I know previous reviewers have mentioned this at length, but no review of this hotel can start without a severe warning about the size of the rooms. This is without doubt the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in (and I speak from a UK/European perspective not from a US perspective, where I know expectations are even higher). At 6"2 tall, I could just about stand up in the hotel room itself, but could not stand up straight in the shower - this is no exageration - I literally had to crouch to fit into the bathroom which, by way of a comparison, is around the same size as that found on a Boeing 737 and probably smaller than the bathroom on the Eurostar on the way over the Paris. Ok, I am exagerating here, but only just. As we were only there for 2 nights, we were travelling light with just two small holdalls. This is just as well as in a standard room, there is literally no space to put a decent sized suitcase. The rooom is so narrow that there is approx 5cm of space either side of the bed - and this does not even include any bedside tables of shelving to place a book or a glass of water. The long and short of it is that it is virutally impossible for two grown adults to spend any length of time in the room together unless they are fast asleep. All in all, this didn't spoil our stay but I do feel the size (or lack thereof) of the rooms are a hugely important factor for anyone even considering this hotel. if you are over 6" tall, then you will feel like a giant anywhere within these four walls. Otherwise this is a charming little hotel which, had it been €100 a night rather than €200+ I would heartily recommend as a chic little bolt-hole in Paris. It only succeeds in justifying this price tag because of its excellent location in the middle of St Germain and within walking distance of all major sites. There are plenty of great bars and restaurants all around and I would thoroughly recommend the location.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but very nice”
Reviews.Author: Pablo H
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be charming and well equiped. The staff was very helpful and with a good attitude. The price was not the best, but then again everything is very expensive in Paris. We were on our Honeymoon trip and they upgraded us to a nice room (a little tight) with view on the street. A little noice with the neighboors, but nothing to complain about. Excelent location in St Germain area. I would definetly recomend it and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in a great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Danlmarsh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights her in early October. The hotel is in great location on fairly quiet side street. The room was smallish but very comfortable and well decorated. The staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good and convenient, but a bit pricey. We really enjoyed the hotel and our only one minor complaint was that the wireless signal was very weak in our room. I woul definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So the rooms are small but the service is huge.”
Reviews.Author: drnodk
Reviews.Content: Iet's not complain about the size of the rooms even though my room was quite large, but let's be concerned about the great location and the great attention given to us by the staff. They went far beyond helping us with whatever problems we had and to me this is what makes for a wonderful stay in a foreign country.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Debra T
Reviews.Content: Just got back from from Paris and our stay at the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain. It was wonderful! It was our first time to Paris and we were celebrating our 25th anniversary. After much research, we decided to stay at the Hotel Odeon. We wanted a true Parisian experenice and this place certainly gave us that. It is beautiful, warm and immaculate. The breakfast room is so charming and the staff, especially Jean Francois, are friendly and helpful. The location can't be beat! We walked to most of the major sights, Notre Dame, the Louvre, the Luxembourg Gardens. The Metro and RER are right around the corner, which is great for getting to Montmartre,the Eiffel Tower and Versailles. We never had an issue finding a place to eat. St Germain has many wonderful cafe's and restaurants. It is truly a perfect spot. We would highly recommend the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain and definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Dingy, dreary dark room with no tub, no room for luggage or clothes.”
Reviews.Author: EllisonG
Reviews.Content: Only the location was worth the bill of over $1,000 for three nights. We travel all the time, and have never been so disappointed. The room was dark and sad, the bathroom had only a shower and tiny sink with no place for toiletries. Never replaced empty shampoo, and included no conditioner. The view was of a dark courtyard. The "concierge" was unfriendly and unhelpful when we arrived at night. Another concierge claimed he didn't speak English (luckily we speak French). The elevator is a flight up, fits ONE person. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a long weekend in Paris and stayed at the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain. It's a very comfortable and charming hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are clean and restful with nice baths and ac. The breakfast is well done and the Honesty Bar is a nice touch. I also think the location is beautiful and within walking distance to many spots such as the Pantheon, St. Sulpice, and Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, etc. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION tiny room”
Reviews.Author: gmeak
Reviews.Content: I'd heard Parisian hotel rooms were small, and found that was very true. But I'm willing to put up with a lot if the location is great and the hotel people are nice. Both of which were absolutely true at the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain. The reception staff were very helpful (they dragged out suitcases up the one flight of steps between the lobby and the elevator) and were just lovely to us the entire time we were there (4 days). Free wifi! YES!! The location was superb! Lots of restaurants and shops within mere feet of the front door, Blvd St Germain just around the corner, Luxembourg Garden and Castle just down the street, etc.,etc, etc. I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and polite service from the moment we arrived”
Reviews.Author: DaveAndRelle
Reviews.Content: We had a luxury suite in this warmly decorated hotel. The staff were so polite and helpful. Breakfasts here were a great start to the day and we could walk to almost every major attraction in Paris. Feeling tired? Then the Odeon subway is right nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable enough in spite of the small room”
Reviews.Author: Puffin77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I paid extra for what was advertised as a luxury room, since we were well aware from previous holidays that you don't get much space in Paris. But it was all to no avail. Furthermore we were shocked at the view from the window - just a very gloomy courtyard. To tell what the weather was doing you had to cran your neck upwards to glimpse a view of the sky. Amusingly, when I returned home I noticed from my confirmation email that a luxury room offers space for a 3rd bed - that'll be a hammock then. Having said all that, once we had unpacked our suitcases and put everything away, we felt better about the hotel. The room was extremely quiet in spite of the hotel being on a very narrow and busy street with much revelry at night. Perhaps that explains the 'luxury' label? The bathroom was fine, there was a safe, and a TV; breakfast was good with plenty of choice of breads, yoghurts, fruit juice etc, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Best of all, the location in the heart of St Germain was superb, with just a minute's walk to the Metro, a 5-minute walk to the Seine at the Pont Neuf, and literally dozens of places to eat within a radius of 200 metres. Since we were not in Paris to sit in our hotel room all day long, the size of the room and the lack of a view was not too tragic, but be warned of what to expect!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Manny M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for five days mid-August 2011. It was fantastic from the get-go. They rushed out the door to help with our bags. We arrived early and our room wasn't quite ready so they expedited the room cleaning and were more than happy to hold all of our bags while we took a stroll to pass the time. They were always professional and the room was great. Same size as all the rooms in Paris but the bathroom had a large tub and was always super-clean when we got in the room every night. Our view was of an interior small courtyard, which was nice and quiet. We felt as if we were getting the quintessential Parisian experience. The area is fantastic, about a 10 minute walk to the Louvre, 15 minutes to Notre Dame and less to the Luxembourgh gardens. The amazing cafe's of Avenue San Germain De Pres were also all extremely close and utterly quaint, as well. Close to metro station too to hit Versailles or Eiffel Tower. Boutique Parisian gem, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: tippet523
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice European hotel in a great neighborhood. It is lively and so many things to do right outside the door. If you are expecting large rooms and a King Size Hotel beds try the USA. It was clean and well run. Make sure to find out if the Palais de Luxembourg is open the weekend you are here as it is fabulous to see. I would also say the rooms are dark and very quiet. Nice place

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: jefkono
Reviews.Content: I don't know if our room is typical of hotel rooms in Paris ... it was very small. My husband had to lay on the bed in order for me to get to the bathroom. I could not dry my hair without keeping the door to the bathroom open so that I could move my arms. When the bathroom door is closed, there still is no privacy as the pocket door does not block sound. The room decor is a garish and the atmosphere is dark and stuffy. But there is free internet and you can use your computer in the lobby. The room is really too small to stay in for working. Of course the location is wonderful. Beware that you are charged for breakfast (about 20$ for tea, croissant, bread...). This was a surprise to me. For a 4 star hotel, I expected more. But perhaps this is the best one can do in the district?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: morevacation
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay overall. Nice for couples looking to unwind in Paris for a long weekend. Would not recommend if you are looking for Parisian luxury - but fits the bill for a nice boutique with some character. Location: perfect for seeing the sites...many things close, plus close to the metro. However, the best part is that it is in a wonderful neighborhood that seems to provide an escape from things... fun to walk around in the evening, plenty of places to eat and drink. Room: very small, but this was expected. Very clean. I would say nothing special here... they are a little dark, which for some may add to the character.. for me, just a bit annoyinng. Overall though, bed was comfortable and was peaceful for sleep. Don't use the elevator if you don't like tight spaces... may be the smallest I have ever seen. Service: has more of a bed and breakfast feel than a hotel feel. We did take advantage of the breakfast in the morning which was good. We did not really require any assistance as we tend to do things on our own. Price: pretty good value for Paris... I think this is a good choice if you are not in the mood to drop big $'s on a luxury hotel... it is a nice middle point that is def. above average. Hint: for any US sports fans out there... there is a sports bar around the corner from this hotel (not a very commone theme in paris) offering the main games. I watched the NCAA tournament and had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “If we can find an excuse to stay here again, we will.”
Reviews.Author: xzander1982
Reviews.Content: We were only there for a night but it was long enough to establish the following: this is a wonderful hotel. Immaculate decor, immaculately clean, reasonably spacious, fixtures and fittings of a high quality. The hotel is located no more than a stone's throw from St Sulpice, perfect location to explore Paris. However the room we were shown to was quiet, peaceful, with windows facing into the hotel rather then outward - no good view but very relaxing all the same considering the choas the Parisien streets represent. We were welcomed by an Italian gentleman who was absolutely charming and did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable. This is an immaculately run, spotlessly presented and charminglt decorated hotel, in a perfect location. I don't know what else to say about it, other than to say that this hotel is highly recommended and ideal for anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and service”
Reviews.Author: Benaroo
Reviews.Content: staff very efficient and great tips on where to eat. Typical Paris room - small but very comfortable. Highly recommended for your stay in Gay Paree.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with the family”
Reviews.Author: chaplo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, quiet and clean rooms, comfortable beds, helpful staff. We stayed in rooms 8&9 which were somewhat ajoined (small private hall between). Perfect for the five of us. Hadn't planned on breakfast at the hotel, based on prior reviews, but did eat there for our last morning. It turned out a good option, with better choices for our 8 and 6 year olds (one of whom has a nut allergy), than we'd found in other restaurants (plus we weren't charged for their meals). Les Editeurs for breakfast was expensive and had poor service; try Neo Cafe on Blvd St Michel which had a great inexpensive breakfast offering omelets and crepes. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Paris hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: pwarne
Reviews.Content: You know how you want to find the perfect Paris hotel? The one that doesn't have a bath masquerading as a shower, terrible water pressure, a slow lift, a disappointing breakfast, indifferent cleaning, towels that they thoughtfully pick up off the floor, fold and hang back on the rack for you, tiny rooms, a great location and really charming staff (apart from the frankly eccentric night porter who asks your name three nights running) who almost make up for the other shortcomings of the place? Well this isn't it. There's enough charm in Paris, sometimes I would just trade efficient and clean for charming.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jmh740
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this lovely small hotel for ten nights in August. The location was perfect, we were able to walk almost anywhere we wanted to go. We stayed in a triple and while the room was small, it was well-designed and we didn't feel cramped. The best thing about this hotel for us was the friendly, helpful staff. Thank you Nicolas, Jean, Julien, Denise, and Jean-Francois!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character & a great location”
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Odeon Saint-Germain for 3 nights in a "triple" room & found it lived up to previous reviews. Room was small (but expected that), clean & quiet. Our 14 yr old son was perfectly happy in his own twin bed (he prefers that to a sleep sofa arrangement). The front desk staff were all friendly & helpful regardless of the hour we came thru. We were on a 15 night trip in Europe that included a cruise so we had a lot of luggage & managed to find room to store it and not trip all over. (It helped that I had packed most everything we needed for the 3 days in Paris in our carry-ons.) Found the location was great for the metro & lots of local dining options. Tons of great cafes in the area. Within walking distance to Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens & the Pantheon. We felt very safe walking around the neighborhood at night too. They provided a desktop computer & printer to use for our airline check-in so we could print our boarding passes which was a nice ammenity. Did not eat at the hotel. Considered breakfast one morning but after looking over the offerings felt we could get more for our 14 pp euro at a local cafe. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend the property others. Only have 2 small complaints. First, on our first morning on our way out for the day we had asked about mailing a postcard back to the states & they offered to mail it for us so I thought GREAT. I then noticed 2 days later at check-out that our postcard was still laying there so I asked for it back so we could handle it ourselves. I kind of expected it to have been mailed already after 2 days. The other thing was a phone call that we made to the transfer company that we were using to the airport. I had assumed that local calls would be free but the next time I checked my email they had sent me an email saying they would be charging us 5+ euros for the call. Nobody had told us that there would be a charge for local calls. When I replied regarding this they then told me that it was to a cell phone (which I don't know how I was supposed to know that I was calling a cell phone nor do I understand what difference that makes in the charge). But so just beware before making ANY phone calls that you'll be charged extra for them. I thought that should've been made clear at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in great Paris neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Edward A
Reviews.Content: Service at the hotel was wonderful, especially given the big group and kids involved. The hotel is located so that so much of the city is walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, worth the four stars”
Reviews.Author: Ciaran_plan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a great area of tonkwn. On arrival they knew who we were and asked if we had been delayed much! Check-in was so quick i was a bit dazed and confused. Receptionist carried up luggage and helped open up window, but was out of the room before I could even offer a tip (honestly!). Room was a little small, but this is Paris and it was very well finished. The shower was excellent and bed (and pillows) very comfortable. Internet is handy and honesty bar is very good. You can have a drink for less than you'll pay in any bar within 5-miles (i think), and receptionist spent half-hour chatting with me whilst i was in the lounge having a drink. Saint-Germain area is beatiful and definately recommend Junction of Saint-Germain and Rue de Seine. p.s. supermarket on R.Seine between Saint-Germain and Buci where you can pick up wine for 4 euro, and of course cork-screw provided in the room "I love a hotel that thinks like i do".

Reviews.Title: “Great area to stay”
Reviews.Author: NZKatey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over three nights and enjoyed our stay. The staff were very helpful and speak English, which is always helpful for people shocking skills in speaking French! The room was a little weird and did not really have a proper window, so it was a little dark and dingy. We expected small, so that part of the room did not bother us at all and really we did not end up back at the hotel very often because we were enjoying Paris. The location of the hotel is just fantastic with great bars and cafes all around and only a short walk to the major attractions. We did not have the breakfast at the hotel because it is surrounded by restaurants. Good coffee and croissants can be found at coutume cafe (47 Rue de Babylone) and de Luxembourg is great to have a picnic in while enjoying the sun (or for the fit, somewhere to have a great run).

Reviews.Title: “took husband and two daughters to Paris, pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: dkhemming
Reviews.Content: Had four days in Paris with the family and was a bit wary about what to expect with the hotel in Paris. I have been a few times before and it can be very hit and miss. This hotel was excellent. It is in a fantastic area,it was clean,quiet and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. Breakfast was included and a perfect start to a busy day in Paris. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Parfait!”
Reviews.Author: mclh
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, perfect service, perfect stay. We booked a junior suite for 7 days. Bed was very comfortable; plenty of space in the room, ample closet/storage space. The bathroom was nicely done; bathtub and shower. We followed the advice of other reviewers and skipped the hotel breakfast and instead tried all of the wonderful places to eat within 2 blocks of the hotel. The Metro was very close. Windows provide excellent soundproofing. I slept really well (and I'm a light sleeper). Only thing I might suggest are blackout curtains. Linens are fabulous. Water pressure is really good. WiFi is strong. I had whittled my choice of hotel down to Hotel Odeon St-Germain and the Hotel d'Aubusson. The Hotel d'Aubusson looked wonderful in person, but I was very happy that we ended up on the side of Boulevard Saint-Germain that we did. We were in a really fabulous neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreenJimmy
Reviews.Content: I got a bit nervous after reading some of the reviews talking about room size but - perhaps because we opted for the deluxe double - our room was perfectly fine. I've had smaller rooms in places like Chicago and New York and it would have been a good size just about anywhere. I could see from the floor plan that some of the rooms are awful small but it depends... As for the rest: -Sometimes had to wait a minute or two but the front desk staff were always accommodating, friendly, helpful and English speaking -Nice to have a computer downstairs for checking email, printing boarding passes etc. but that French keyboard can be a challenge -Couldn't imagine a better location, just off the main streets but a short walk from the Metro, cafes, Luxembourg Gardens and more -FWIW, greater water pressure and temperature in the bath/shower. I feel like I should give 4/5 on principle but I really can't think of anything to fault the the hotel for, so 5 it is!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms are a little claustrophobic.”
Reviews.Author: Tkyrnr
Reviews.Content: Good place if you want to stay in a reasonable place in Saint Germain. Rooms are a little claustrophobic but well decorated. Concierge and front desk services are decent for a hotel this size. Breakfast service is standard continental.

Reviews.Title: “This is second stay for Mrs Marilyn Harwood this year, I will be going back”
Reviews.Author: MarilynHarwood
Reviews.Content: The outside of the hotel does not give credit to what is inside. It is very well situated. One could not ask for more from the staff, they are very eager to please their guests. Nothing seems to be too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant find!!”
Reviews.Author: Gilly_Aus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The hotel has a fantastic feel to it. It is intimate and softly lit. The room we stayed in was small but lovely. There were exposed ceiling that gave it a really nice feel. Chocolates were laid out, box on arrival, and a couple each day. The staff we brilliant. All spoke English fluently. We had assistance with our bags up to the first floor where a lift took us the rest of the way. The location is fantastic and felt very local with few of the tourist trap restaurants and bars in other areas. Overall we would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely--not elegant but fine”
Reviews.Author: jkotler
Reviews.Content: I am a smoker and a solo traveler. So I always have 2 fears when traveling: as a single person will I get a terrible room?and CAN I SMOKE? So MOST Paris (and European) hotels will tell you they are non-smoking only, but nearly all have large opening windows, so it doesn't really matter. Fact is, you can smoke. There's an obscure law relating to this. (Might be more problematic if you are traveling in the winter and need to keep the windows closed. I don't travel then, so can't comment.) Location is perfect, especially for me, whose favorite place in Paris is the Luxembourg Gardens, One block from a metro station and very close to many other things. (It was really fun to see Midnight in Paris at the featured theater before it got to the US!) Lots of restaurants nearby. Though venturing out to La Condonnerie is WELL worth the effort. DO NOT EAT AT IL SUPLICE--though the Editeurs across the street is fine. I wouldn't spring for the 12 euro breakfast--especially since steps away are several cafes serving the same or better at better prices. I was very impressed with the cleaning service--it seemed like most days (I was there for 8 days) by the time I came back from breakfast the room was made up. Amazing. I think I paid about $190 American a night. Paris--and getting there--is getting prohibitively expensive. I am used to going twice a year on a small salary, but I think that is about to change unpleasantly. I DO know that next time I'll rent an apartment and stay longer given the airfare.

Reviews.Title: “A great slice of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Esmeerory
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this property during out time in Paris. Its location, its charm and the great staff made the experience one of a lifetime. Paris is a wonderful and complex city and having residence in a hotel that allows you to be part of its magic is a treat. We hope to return in the near future and wish all that cross its doors a grand time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find - - will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: savvyjayne
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel is situated in the heart of all the restaurants and shops that make Paris special. I would say location, location location but that does not do enough justice to the yummy beds (great sheets too), welcoming and lovely staff, tastful decor, serene lobby (great respite from the hectic streets of Paris), and small other details that make this a fabulous choice in Paris. Our particular room was on the back aka very quite, but not dark like some hotels can be on the "back". All the amenities of a large hotel like mini bar, ample closet/hangers, great blow dryer (for us ladies), lovely deep bath tub, air conditioning (which came in handy as we were there in a heat wave) and fluffy white robs. We were very very pleased and happy to have discovred this hotel and can't wait to visit again soon. We even tried to extend our stay for a day or two but they were fully booked and - -we understand why! Have no fear when booking here. :) PS we did not try the breakfast, but it looked lovely complete with Nespresso coffee, etc. . . Enjoy as we can't say enough good things about our stay as there is not enough space here.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful with trip plans”
Reviews.Author: acbante
Reviews.Content: The consierge went above and beyond the call of duty! He helped us arrange a day trip to another town. The hotel was comfortable and in a great location close to everything that you want to see. Bathroom was newly decorated and clean. Room was clean. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Money - great location”
Reviews.Author: sully314
Reviews.Content: This quaint small boutique hotel is in a great, great spot. I was worried that the side street might be a bit scary after dark...but it's right off a main blvd and in a busy area. But not so busy that the hotel is noisy. Quite the contrary...Was on the 2nd floor (room 21) facing the courtyard and it was soooo quiet. Super friendly staff. Spoke perfect English. Very accommodating. The elevator was tiny, tiny...I couldn't get my 28" suitcase in it...the stairs were really tight. But the desk staff carried my bag up for me...so it wasn't a problem. Booked a single room...it was really small. I had to move the bed to make room on the floor for my suitcase. But size was what I expected ...pics on their site were pretty true. And I was out all day anyway. Most importantly, room was very clean. It smelled good...not that musty smell that you find in some European hotels. Bed was comfy. Flat screen TV and Wi-Fi were great! Updated bathroom had nice fixtures, new tile, great light, L'Occitain products replaced daily...and best of all an Elchim hairdryer....not the standard dinky dryer that most hotels have. Was super excited to see that!! Clientele seemed to be mostly families and/or couples. Which was great..no screaming drunks running through the halls at 2am. Overall I was really happy with my choice. I would stay here again and totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small comfy boutique hotel in St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: bmorechris
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain for two nights in mid May. This was our first trip to Paris and we decided to stay in a smaller Parisian hotel instead of one of the larger chains. We arrived by train to Paris and took the Metro to the Odeon stop which was only a short walk to the hotel which was on a small but busy street. We arrived at 1130 and our room was ready which we were happy about. We were taken towards the back and up a small staircase to a landing with doors to two rooms. I believe ours was room 31. It was a standard double room as we booked, and was small but well laid out. There was a double bed, desk, and small closet. The large window overlooked a small courtyard and fountain. The bathroom was small, the small outer room had a toilet and sink facing each other, and then beyond was a tiled shower. Water pressure and temperature were excellent and it was very clean. The bed only had a comforter, so we requested an additional bed sheet and it was delivered to our room after we had gone out. All the staff were courteous and greeted you as you returned or left the hotel, and they all spoke English, along with a variety of other languages. The hotel key was a standard key card, and the room had heat and air conditioning. At check-in we were given a code to access the free wireless internet which worked perfectly. We did not have the breakfast at the hotel, we simply grabbed pastries from nearby shops. the location was quite good. Only a couple of blocks to the Metro, as well as to a bus stop which has a line that takes you right to the Eiffel Tower (along with other places). there are little shops and cafes all around, as well as the Jardin du Luxembourg just to the south which was a very peaceful and interesting place to spend the early evening. We walked to Notre Dame and the Louvre from the hotel, each in about 10-15 minutes. Overall it was a comfortable and decent hotel for central Paris, and lived up to our expectations. the room and bathroom were small, but we expected that. I would recommend trying to get an interior room to avoid the chance at hearing noise from the street, as there were a good number of cars and there is a bar a few doors down that seemed to be busy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GMFLondon
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 wonderful nights here. Our suite was perfect - not huge but spacious, charming and very well appointed. The staff could not have been more helpful. The location was wonderful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced hotel with very small rooms and no facilities”
Reviews.Author: Torassa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights for a short break in Paris. While the location in the hart of Saint Germain is excellent, the hotel it self does not deserve the high rankings it seems to be getting on this site. We stayed in a socalled "junior suite", at the pricy rate of over 330 euro's a night (excl breakfast), but the room and bathroom were very tiny. Toilet was built in to a closet. The lift is so small that it can barely take 2 persons. The hotel has no facilities whatsoever and is very dark and dimly lit. The hotel has no restaurant and very basic breakfast facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tygergirl
Reviews.Content: The Odeon St. Germain is a boutique hotel on a quiet street in a great neighborhood. After much research we (group of six women) decided to stay in the Odeon based on its proximity to the Seine and the metro (although we walked everywhere!) and its unique style and swank. It was a great decision. I would definitely stay there again on future trips to Paris. There are great restaurants very close to the hotel, and awesome boutiques for shopping. The room and bathroom were sizeable enough to be comfortable. Alot of people have issues with the size of hotel rooms in Paris, but I can assure you that the Odeon is adequate. We did make use of the closet and the hotel was kind enough to provide us with enough hangars so that we could hang our clothes instead of living out of our suitcase. The toiletries were nice. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The concierege was very helpful and even managed to book a table for us at the Grand Colbert where the movie "Somethings Gotta Give" was filmed. Let me rephrase, not just a table, but THE table where the movie's scene was shot. It was a highlight of our trip and the Odeon made it possible. They were also very helpful with getting us taxis to restaurants and train stations when needed. The breakfast is good, although the price is a little steep. While several of us enjoyed meeting every morning for breakfast, others in our group got coffee around the corner at the Starbucks. The hotel really should consider lowering the price a little. I think if the hotel lowered the price a little, I think they would not have lost the business of our other three traveling companions.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price - look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Zeebs3
Reviews.Content: After weeks of research on TA we booked the Odeon Saint-Germain for our 4 day stay in Paris, what a let down. We were prepared for small cramped rooms, pompous attitudes, long lines for our first trip to Paris and we booked the Odeon thinking it would be a comfortable home base after a long day of touring the city. This is not that welcoming, relaxing hotel we were looking for. The location is excellent and despite our minimal time spent at the Hotel we couldn't get away long or fast enough. Yes the rooms/bathrooms are small (to be expected) but the bed and pillows are stuffed with cotton balls (litterally) very uncomfortable. The entire Hotel is so poorly lit we felt like we were in a basement the entire time. Our room was on the 4th floor, the staircase is spiral, dark and essentially impossible to navigate with luggage. This Hotel is not cheap and definitley not worth the price you'll pay for the service/rooms/overall experience. We still had a great time in Paris but our next trip will not be spent at the Hotel Odeon Saint Germain, I'm not sure how this place has the excellent reviews.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the charm”
Reviews.Author: carmen155019
Reviews.Content: We loved the charm and gracious service provided at the hotel. The room was spotless and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and ample. Our only criticism is that the room was very small, but that's Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice french style hotel in a local area”
Reviews.Author: mattfyr
Reviews.Content: Locate in the cafe, shopping, business area of Paris. The hotel looks small from outside, the room we got was pretty small, with a large bed that we hardly can walk passby. Bath room is fine but also very small. All in all room is nice though, since we did not spend so much time in the hotel. The location is very good, lots of cafe just down the streets, and metro not so far and a walking distance to several attractions. the price is a bit heavy so look around to see if you have a good deal in the same area first.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: benchickens
Reviews.Content: We booked for a week in this hotel based on Tripadvisor recommendations. We had room 34 facing the interior. First off, the positives - a great location very close to the metro and surrounded by many great boutiques, bars, bistros and restaurants. You could walk to the Louvre in about 20 min which is often more convenient than catching trains. Our room was very quiet and we always slept well. The negatives - a really, really tiny room - I'm not sure if ours was the smallest in the hotel but I don't see how it could have been any smaller. We had virtually no room to open our suitcases and only one bedside table. Shower was almost laughably tiny! Also, the pillows were so lumpy, feeling like they had been stuffed with cotton balls. Surely it would not be too much of an expense to replace them from time to time?! The hotel is in a very old building so the lobby and common areas are very narrow and dark, with steep stairs to the room. Wifi in the room was workable but slow at peak times. Unfortunately it wasn't a hotel we looked forward to coming back to after a day of sightseeing, and we would recommend it only for those on a tight budget for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the bill conversion”
Reviews.Author: Joe1029384756
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a lovely stay. Friendly, attentive staff with great dinner recommendations. Excellent location, quiet and clean rooms, though smaller than I expected for a "double executive". Here's my one complaint, and it's significant: at checkout, the bill listed the amount in both euros and U.S. dollars. The euros amount was what I had booked, so I signed and went to the airport. It wasn't until we were home days later that I realized they had charged me in U.S. dollars, and the conversion was significantly unfavorable compared to what I would have paid had my credit card just been charged in euros. The difference was about a hundred dollars for my bill. Nowhere was this conversion detailed in the final bill, and it was never mentioned at the time of booking, check-in, or check-out. We read reviews on trip advisor extensively before booking and never read anything about this issue, so I can only assume most guests are unaware that they're paying more than the rate they reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically located boutique, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sulliclm
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the end of April on a weekend getaway. The hotel's location is perhaps it's best feature, located in the 6e, 100m or so from the Odeon metro stop (which links directly to Gare du Nord) and a 5 minute walk to the St. Michel RER stop which goes direct to the Eiffel tower and Versailles among other places. Notes Dame and the Louvre are also within easy walking distance. We had room 34 on the second floor facing into the interior, room was clean and nicely appointed. Not huge, but not crazy small either. Bed was fine, good shower, small closet with a good size in room safe. One great service is the free wifi, which we took advantage of. Room was plenty quiet, even with windows open, except for one night when a pair of fellow americans across the courtyard decided to open their windows so we could hear their incredibly loud skype call home at 2am, (thanks for that guys, glad you're so excited to be in Paris!) The service was the other thing that stood out, staff spoke impeccable English and were very helpful, held our bags in the final day for us, and recommended a great spot for dinner (bistro de l'alycastre) and got us reservations. All in all a great find, will be back on our next trip

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: NiedsReads
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay! Elegant but casual, our room was outstanding and overlooked a lovely courtyard. The staff could not have been kinder--and very helpful. Clean, comfortable, located right in the middle of a great district, the Odeon exceeded our expectations. I could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique - super location”
Reviews.Author: 2of7
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel Odeon, and loved it. The deluxe rooms are nice size for Paris, the desk is very helpful, the breakfast is delightful, and it is in a perfect location. Near a good metro stop, not far from RER, and there is a neat collection of restaurants and pubs two blocks away. I would stay there again for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Met our high expectations!”
Reviews.Author: bfischer1
Reviews.Content: excellent staff, good English, cozy, great location! street rooms can be little noisy if windows are opened

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, clean, friendly and stylish - noisy room though”
Reviews.Author: ianjindal
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to its billing. Location is wonderful to explore the area and close to a metro and taxi rank. Cosy, stylish and friendly, my room (#29) was on the ground floor and - oddly for Parisian boutique hotels - there was enough room to walk around the bed (!) put a case down and some storage. Bathroom was large for the hotel. The walls were very thin, however, and so all comings and goings could be heard from the corridor, other rooms and the dining area. Also, all night there was a persistent sound of running water through pipes. I slept like a log, however, and the bed was comfortable - one just attenuated to the noise, but it'd put off light sleepers. Props to the hotel, too, for their free, robust wifi in all rooms. For the location, quality and friendliness this is a hotel to which I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, rooms, and service. Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Ottom10
Reviews.Content: Took my wife here for a quick long weekend getaway for her 40th birthday. We arrived early (~8:30AM) - well before check-in - and they were more than accomodating. Very professional, courteous, and civilized staff - more than happy and willing to please - even with our non-existant french skills. Rooms were typically Paris smallish, but well designed and furnished. Bathroom well outfitted and clean. We opted for breakfast, which was good, although a bit on the pricey side. For convenience, go for it, but you can find much better deals outside. Regardless, I was happy with everything about the hotel and I've stayed in a number of other hotels in the same area of Paris. Would return here gladly. Cheers to the management and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: blenge1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel. The rooms are small but clean and very comfortable. The bathrooms are lovely too. This is a great part of Paris to stay in and you don't have to walk far to find lovely places to eat. The room I stayed in was on the second floor facing on to the street. I'm easily woken but I can happily say this was one of the quietest hotels I've stayed in. The breakfast is well worth the 14 euros that it costs. The staff are also excellent and very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint with excellent service in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Franklynflyermiles
Reviews.Content: I came to Paris for a quick Valentine getaway with my husband. Our stay was perfect. The rooms are quaint and tidy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location is perfect. The Louvre and Nortre Dame is in walking distance. What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Jacques Garcia's elegant design turns this tucked away St. Germain hotel into a very chic spot.”
Reviews.Author: michester
Reviews.Content: The Odéon Saint-Germain is a chic boutique hotel in the absolutely perfect Parisian location. Having traveled to Paris for twenty years, I prefer the Saint Germain quartier. This hotel is steps away from boutiques and restaurants, but it is on a quiet street, which is highly desirable. The decor in the foyer and dining room is quintessentially Jacques Garcia, and it is an excellent spot to invite friends for an intimate cocktail before an evening out. The staff is perfectly bilingual and they are graciously willing to help with any circumstances or situations that might arise during one's stay. The rooms are well-appointed, with beautiful curtains and bed trimmings. Although the bathrooms are small, they are clean and modern. I would certainly recommend this chic hotel to anyone traveling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable, clean and courteous.”
Reviews.Author: EastSussexRoz
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 3 day/2 night stay in Paris at Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain, which is in a lovely old Paris town house full of character. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or charming, from the management to the waitress. The room was tastefully decorated, cosy, clean and well thought out, I especially liked the individual reading lights by the bed. The bathroom (shower only) was compact but had everything we needed, Our room (standard) overlooked the courtyard and so was lovely and quiet and the comfy beds added up to a good nights sleep. We ordered breakfast and it was very good, with a wide choice of fresh food. It was good value at 14E, especially if you ate as much as my husband! We didn't need lunch. The location is excellent, close to Odeon metro and a variety of good shops and restaurants. The only problem a visitor might have is if they are very over weight. The lift is tiny (we had great fun with our friends trying to fit in the three people it says that it holds) and the staircase steep and narrow, but from my experience this is typical in small Paris boutique hotels. I would definitely recommend the hotel and hope to stay there again when next we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful location!!”
Reviews.Author: vanleeVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last summer for five nights, but forgot to post my review so am doing it now. We were travelling with another couple and we all enjoyed our stay here. We choose this hotel based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and we must voice our agreement with all the positive reviews. . The first night we were in small standard room on top floor, quite adequate, clean and comfortable, but too small for five night stay. We asked for and received an uprade to premium room and enjoyed the larger space. Service at the hotel was excellent and the front desk was most helpful with advise, directions, etc. The hotel is REALLY well located, close to restaurants, sidewalk cafes, shopping and transit, and right beside the Latin Quarter. We walked most everywhere. We recommend you do not pay for breakfast at the hotel but walk a block or two to small cafes - excellent coffee and pastries to die for!!! Also we had pre purchased a five day Paris pass - but would not do that again, did not use it enough to get our money's worth. We walked most everywhere, and although lineu-ups at major attractions were long (middle of tourist season) with planning, we saw most everything we wanted. The Paris pass allows you to bypass the lineup for ticket purchases but not the lineups for entrance to the attractions Will definttely stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great decor, great location, great service - will definitely be back.”
Reviews.Author: lawyer3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely; we had a room on the third floor which was a very good size; the decor in the room was very tasteful. The room and bathroom were very clean, and the staff very helpful. The location is also excellent - very central. I didn't pay the bill so have no idea of costs, but this is a place I would love to come back too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect St. Germain location, but some misses”
Reviews.Author: beantown_illini
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at this hotel over the New Year’s holiday. Originally, we were in room 15 on the 5th floor which is quite possibly the smallest hotel room I’ve ever been in. I know European hotel rooms are typically smaller, but this was a bit much. It felt like we were staying in someone’s attic, not to mention it reeked of cigarette smoke despite being a non-smoking room. We contacted the front desk to be moved but the hotel was fully-booked that night. However, they offered to give us a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite the following day. Luckily we weren’t in our room too terribly much the first night. But when it was time to go to bed we obviously were, and the bed was lumpy and uncomfortable and the pillows weren’t any better. As promised, the staff moved us to a junior suite the next day. It was room 4 on the 2nd floor and was much more spacious and odor-free. That said, it still left a lot to be desired. The bed was uncomfortable and the lighting was awful. There was also quite a bit of noise from the room next door. A few pluses – L’Occitane toiletries and free wifi. Our rate included breakfast and it was okay—your basic continental breakfast. They have an “honesty bar” which was handy—take what you want and note it accordingly and they will charge your room. The common areas are really cozy and charming. While I wasn’t overwhelmed with this place, the one thing I can’t speak highly enough of was the staff. They were very accommodating and they truly aim to please. There was one gentleman whose name I don’t recall, but he seemed to be there around the clock and always had a friendly attitude. They were all great in helping with directions and suggestions. They also left a box of chocolates in our room the first night, which was a nice and surprising touch. In addition to the great staff, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Culturally peaceful visit”
Reviews.Author: gazza011
Reviews.Content: Arriving on the post Christmas and New Year tide Paris was a joy to be found. Calm, peaceful and relaxed. The hotel is based in the heart of every facility south of the river with cafes on every corner and boutiques of a high quality to be found in the surrounding maze of streets. The hotel was of a high standard of cleanliness with fresh sheets every other day. The hotel has character and charm and the staff remain unobtrusive but available if you need them. The breakfast is worth doing but would benefit if it was included on the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and accomodation, would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: amybatt
Reviews.Content: I picked this for the location primarily, and the price secondarily. We got executive twin rooms for a significant discount due to it being off-season. The hotel is excellently located on a street that is surprisingly quiet; the Odeon Metro stop is about 2 minutes on foot and there are several restaurants nearby, including Le Comptoir and those I liked on our last trip there on rue Christine. The twin room was large by French standards. We had room to walk and move, a large closet, a desk and very good sized bathroom. The shower was set into the wall and a good two foot step up which is tough when you're nearly blind without your glasses. But I was happy with our choice; the hotel was very clean, very quiet and well run. The staff spoke excellent English and were helpful with directions and suggestions. We did have the 14 euro breakfast each day, which was very well-stocked and convenient and the staff was very pleasant that early in the day. I'm not sure I would pay (or could afford) high season prices, but this is well worth the splurge in the off-season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Ebigo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a nice area with great restaurants around the corner. The Metro is few meters away. Breakfast is not included in the hotel rate but the breakfast choice is good. The room though a bit small is comfortable and functional. The reception staff are helpful and friendly. There is a computer in the lobby for complimentary use by guests.

Reviews.Title: “a great find in Europe, very accessible to metro, shops, excellent restaurants. Great staff”
Reviews.Author: bdelgado1101
Reviews.Content: -Great Staff, very helpful -cozy, homelike atmosphere -more lighting in rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boutique Hotel in Odeon”
Reviews.Author: PreppyBookworm
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with the quality of our stay at this hotel. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful, working with us via email in advance of our booking to arrange restaurants and tickets. The rooms, while European in size (i.e. snug), were VERY clean and well provisioned with nice toiletries and looked to be recently updated. We had a room that overlooked the "courtyard" in the back which was wonderfully quiet. The location is also great-- walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame and Saint Suplice, 2 minutes to the metro, 10 minutes to the nearest RER, and super close to great restaurants like Les Editeurs and Le Comptoir. Overall, would definitely recommend it to other travelers and friends.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: BambiTelaviv
Reviews.Content: It is our second visit to Odeon Saint Germain and once again we extremely enjoyed our stay. We love it so much that we declared it as our home in Paris. It is one of the most romantic, beautifully decorated and cosiest hotels we have ever stayed in, and the service was excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: Risa2242
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. Being our first trip to Paris, we were looking for a small Parisian hotel. Hotel Odeon was very cozy and friendly. The staff gave good dinner suggestions and were always willing to call a cab or give directions. Our room was small (that's Paris) but clean. The bathroom was also very small but also clean and had nice L'occitane amenities. Our room faced the street, but it was very quiet in our room. We had breakfast every morning. The pastries and bread were delicious and the coffee was also very good. It is not like an American breakfast (not like eggs/bacon/pancakes). We also liked the neighborhood it was in- lots of food options and seemed like a central location to venture out and see the sights of beautiful Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected and hoped for...'”
Reviews.Author: Dreamer1NewZealand
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at this lovely hotel in October and couldn't have been more pleased. We stayed in room 3 above the lounge area and overlooking the street. It had a little more space than some of the others and was lovely and quiet. This hotel has everything you need and is so convenient to sights, lovely cafes, shopping and the river. It was just so easy staying there. The service was exemplary and the cafes they recommended were lovely. We found plenty of breakfast options close by, one of the best patisseries in Paris only 50 meters away, so we didn't use the breakfast option in the hotel though it looked nice. Would stay there again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Boston1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a find - fantastic location, great service with very friendly and helpful staff - but best of all our room was perfect. Fantastically clean and well designed and decorated and of a decent size for the price and location. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The location, ambience of the hotel, friendliness of the staff....basically everything was terrific”
Reviews.Author: 64Montreal
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautifully renovated and refurbished about three years ago. The staff at the front desk were very helpful and spoke English very well (we speak no French). The buffet breakfast was excellent, but there are alternatives nearby if you want to spend less than the 14 Euro charge, The hotel is very quiet despite being so close to major, busy downtown avenues.

Reviews.Title: “Old Paris with a touch of chic”
Reviews.Author: madglobetrotter
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel not too modern and not too old paris yet comfortable. I was very glad to know it was exactly what I wanted. Although I didn't stay long, I would have if I had the chance and would definitely stay there again. It was within walking distance to great restaurants, sightseeing and in the heart of paris. I would definitely recommend to any couples as it was very cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Hotel Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: mebflanders
