Reviews.Content: The beautiful room was a good size with a comfortable bed, a nice sitting area with a table, and a great bathroom. The service was fantastic. Everyone at the hotel was wonderful, especially the concierges. They were incredibly helpful with any request, no matter how small, with quick response time. Also the location is great! It is within easy walking distance of a bunch of Metro stations, museums and sights, restaurants and cafes, and lots of shops. I really can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and charming hotel and staff. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: BFlanders
Reviews.Content: Great location near cultural sites, cafes and restaurants, huge variety of shops, and metro. Excellent and very helpful staff for any and all questions/requirements. Very charming guest rooms and public spaces. Very clean. English-speaking guests will have no problems. This was our second stay this year with our extended family. Plan to stay there again when we return to Paris next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrueReviewTexas
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this boutique. Rooms are small and we had even upgraded to a junior suite, but then we have heard all rooms in Paris are small (we did have a very nice and big bath room). It was also very quiet. The trade off was for the location. The staff could not have been nicer. VERY accommodating to our needs and help with directions, reservations and ideas. We also had a Starbucks 1 1/2 blocks from our front door. Really liked Marco Polo Restaurant at the end of the block (Italian but had great fish specials) - recommended by the hotel. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Bijou Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Nixin_10
Reviews.Content: You will not regret staying at this hotel. Like most (if not all) Paris hotels, the rooms are tiny, but in this instance, they are perfectly formed and in no way leave you feeling claustrophobic. Instead you will marvel at their clever design and you'll feel comfortable in the fairly plush surroundings. Minutes away from Odéon tube station and tucked away from the crowds on a quiet street in a chic neighbourhood, you could do A LOT worse, and not much better than Hotel Odeon Saint Germain. Once again, I booked this hotel as part of a package with Expedia. The hotel and Eurostar tickets for my partner and me cost £250 ea for one night. Close to the Jardin du Luxembourg, the metro and close to Notre-Dame and the Louvre the hotel serves as the perfect base from which to explore the city by foot. Everything is easily within walking distance and the streets immediately around the hotel are lined with clothing boutiques and other odds and ends gems. The beds are big and comfortable, the rooms are clean, simple and well decorated. The bathroom had a massive shower space - which was in itself pretty impressive and there's a safe for valuables. The elevator cannot get more than two people in it, but this is rather fun when you both tumble out at the bottom leaving those waiting for the lift wondering what all the laughing is all about. The staff are attentive and not cloying in any way and there's a cozy room just off the reception area where you can relax with a glass of wine or cup of coffee without feeling the need to rush off anywhere else. We were only in Paris for one night and it rained for a good part of our stay, but I adored our hotel and would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very high quality place with small rooms, but it's Paris”
Reviews.Author: ryans69
Reviews.Content: Our room on the top (5th) floor was small, but had a sitting area with a side table and two chairs. The room faced the back and was extremely quiet. Bathroom was small and could be difficult for taller people, but nicely appointed. L'Occitane bath amenities included. Quality of room fittings very high. The lights in the room were on dimmer and could be turned very low - other reviews noted dim lighting, but perhaps they did not try the dimmer (it was not exactly intuitive). A/C worked well, contrary to other reviews (but outdoor temps 75 during our visit). WIFI worked and was included, just get the code at front desk at check-in...it was offered to me without even asking. Front desk staff friendly but you might have to ask twice for something. We did not have breakfast at the hotel but it looked good. The location is awesome - close to restaurants, cafes, Metro, and sightseeing - 10 minute walk to Notre Dame, and you can feel safe walking around the hotel at all hours. Overall, this hotel feels small, intimate, and they will recognize you. Your partner will be impressed by your choice of the hotel, it feels romantic and warm. The rooms and public spaces feel like Paris, not like a chain or a Holiday Inn. Unless you really need a "large" room, this is a very good choice for a special "jewel box" hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise528992
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff who spoke very good English. Rooms well appointed double glazing so nice and quiet. We could purchase tickets to Le Louvre at reception which meant no queues for us. Location was fabulous. We could walk to great cafes, to Le Louvre and the river Seine. Breakfast wonderful. Beautifully furnished. I will stay there again when I revisit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality/ location with a small room”
Reviews.Author: garth1968
Reviews.Content: Lets get this right out there to start....the bathroom was small( if you are over 6'2", you will have the same issues I had), the bed was tucked under the dormer cape setting of the top floor and the air conditioning for the hot days/ nights was substandard. Needless to say, you felt like you were bent over at times while walking around the room. With this being said, my wife and I had a wonderful time at Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain. Great staff, as they( Matthew) upgraded us to the top floor which was their bigger rooms without even asking for it. The Hotel was in a great location as their were tons of restaurants and bars within a stones throw from the Hotel. Metro Odeon was a 2 minute walk and to boot, there was a Starbucks right there is you wanted to keep the American coffee in the system. Value was awesome we thought. Complimentary Wi-Fi which was not the norm for anywhere in Europe at even higher costs per night. Book the Hotel...and don't look back!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Paris hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Westchester13
Reviews.Content: Hotel has lots of charm, and is well located in the lovely neighborhood of Saint Germain, with loads of cafes, restaurants, shops, nearby. Also near Luxembourg Gardens. Rooms were very well appointed, clean and modern (flat screen tvs, nice modern bathrooms). Rooms are small by American standards, but that's Paris. The English speaking staff were wonderful - went out of their way to assist, made great recommendations for restaurants, shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff, and great value”
Reviews.Author: TH22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Hotel Odeon St. Germain for 5 nights and really enjoyed it. There are so many hotel choices in Paris and so many mixed reviews for every hotel it was hard to make a decision. The staff at the Hotel Odeon St. Germain were professional, friendly, attentive, and helpful throughout our stay. Our room was small but modern, very comfortable, and quiet. We stayed on an upper floor with a courtyard view. Although there is a ridiculously small elevator (we laughed at how small it was) I might recommend staying on a lower floor since the area is fairly quiet anyhow. The hotel is in a great location, outside of the touristy Latin quarter by St. Michels but close to Notre Dame, the Seine, and Luxembourg Palace. There are tons of restaurants nearby and the metro is very convenient to the hotel. Its easy to get to from CDG, just take the RER B to Chatelet, then the Metro to Odeon stop.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain”
Reviews.Author: CABonVoyage
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks almost a year ago and have been meaning to write something ever since. I selected this hotel after reading the reviews here and actually corresponding with a couple of other reviewers who very kindly answered my questions. As everyone has said, the location could not be better and the staff could not be more pleasant and helpful. Matthieu, Jean, Joseph ... and several others whose names I unfortunately did not obtain were all extremely kind and professional and made the stay even more enjoyable as a result. I had a "Junior Suite" and the room was lovely and quiet. While Parisian rooms are much smaller and this would be small by most US "junior suite" standards, there was a seating area with a table and two chairs, a decently sized closet and plenty of room around the bed. There was also a mini-fridge which was a pleasant surprise and came in handy. The bathroom was clean and updated. If I had any complaints, they would be in regard to lighting (wish there was more/brighter lighting especially in the bathroom) and the television which didn't have the best reception or channel selection (not that I actually even turned it on that often ... it's Paris after all!). Breakfasts are very nice, and the Jacques Garcia decor in the lobby/breakfast area is wonderful. This hotel could not be better situated and I agree with others who have said it is a bargain for quality, location and service. Be sure to check out Gerard Mulot, a bakery just a couple of minutes away on Rue de Seine (also within walking distance are Pierre Herme, Mariage Freres, Laduree ... and some wonderful restaurants ... write me for recommendations!).

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: shabbasimo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent a great weekend at this hotel and were really impressed. The rooms are very chic (and with an extremely comfortable bed) and the staff were so friendly and helpful. The location is a winner as it is right in the heart of St Germain with the church of Saint Sulpice at the end of the road -so charming Whenever we get the chance to return to Paris we will look no further and definately book this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location, Fabulous Staff”
Reviews.Author: chidukies
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Odeon St. Germain for 4 nights in July. We had last been here 18 years ago - but the Hotel has been completely remodeled and updated since then. It is a small, quaint and classic hotel. The rooms are clean, well appointed and nicely air conditioned. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and assisted with dinner reservations, directions and airport transport. The breakfast area is a delight and a wonderful environment from which to start your day. The hotel is centrally located with easy access to the metro at Odeon or RER at Luxembourg or easy walks to many central sites. We hope it is not another 18 years before we return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality - Great Location - Great”
Reviews.Author: hamrock
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of all the great things posted on Trip Advisor. We were EXTREMELY happy with this choice. The bathroom was wonderful and the AC was very welcome because of the heat wave that rolled through on our trip. The staff was very helpful and informative and there is so much to do in this area. Because it was so well located, we only used the Metro once or twice during the entire week. We will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent little hotel, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: smoothtalk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a really good location, very close to the Metro and central, within walking distance of many of the city's major attractions. The rooms aren't large, but have atmosphere, and I found the staff helpful. By the standards of Paris, the room rate I secured didn't seem exorbitant. It was fairly quiet, too. But there are some negatives. Noise from adjacent rooms was too obvious. More problematic was the bathroom: good toiletries, but a truly terrible shower - no water pressure, a very unsatisfactory fixture, and a shower curtain that was laughably inadequate. Overall, this ranks as one of the better hotels I've stayed in while in Paris, and it's a good base for tourism, but it's not hugely glamorous or overwhelmingly slick.

Reviews.Title: “Quintessentially Parisian and beautiful accommodation”
Reviews.Author: AlexinLondon
Reviews.Content: Hospitality was great and the rooms were beautifully decorated. Very welcoming to families. Breakfast was good value. Hotel is close to fantastic restaurants and shops in the St. Germaine area. Definitely will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Boutique Hotel - A true Gem in the heart of Cool Paris”
Reviews.Author: MiniTony
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, Matthew is at the front desk during the day and he immediately makes you feel welcome and helps you get comfortable so you can get on with enjoying Paris. Very cool hotel with clean value for money rooms. Location is super for taxis, metro and taking walks. Fully recommend and will be back to stay next time

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Great Location, Unforgettable Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: mmskidmore
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Odeon. This was my third trip to Paris and I really enjoyed the lively location. Well suited to finding quaint restaurants, peaceful at night, close to a beautiful park for running, and centrally located near a metro stop. The room was small, but well furnished and clean (and who stays in their room in Paris anyway!). The staff was HELPFUL and friendly, making reservations and suggestions at every turn. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy spacious room, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: chsblk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Odeon Saint Germain for 4 nights and we were very glad to find this hotel. We booked it b/c of the good Trip Advisor ratings. We had a nice, spacious room with enough space to unload bags and store away clothes. There was a chenille covered chaise lounge for an extra place to sit and relax. We had two comfortable twin beds with night lights for reading. The bathroom was small but sufficient with deep tub and a hand held or attached shower and plenty of water pressure. We had a very pleasant stay with soundproof rooms with big double window overlooking street that we could open for fresh air or close if needed to shut out noise. Location great for 3 really good Italain restaurants, Il Suppli, Marco Polo, and Casa Beninni (sp?). (We like Italian food better than French food)..also close to market and ice cream and Odeon metro. The street was quiet for the most part and we were very happy with the location. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique hotel in the center of the city!”
Reviews.Author: cjgnyc
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Stayed for four nights in June and the accomodations were exactly what i was looking for. Did not want a big chain hotel with no personlaity nor a cramped quarters with no charm. Odeon had a trendy boutique feel and was perfectly located in the heart of a trendy area with lots of nightlife and cafes! We walked everywhere from here and metro access is super convenient with the Odeon stop only 1 block away and St Michel only about 3 blocks away. We took the RER to both CDG and Orly airports from St Michel with ease and also a day trip to Versailles. Didn't need to take a taxi at all! Looking on your map, the hotel is on the same street at the famous St Sulpice church, about 1 block away. Our room was #15 at the top and we were told it was the best in the hotel. We loved it! It had a small sitting area adjacent to the bedroom which made it feel larger and was a nice place for use to enjoy some wine while getting ready to head out at night or after returning from a log day of walking and touring. The hotel staff were the best! I am sorry to have forgotten their names or I would certainly thank them so much right now! They spoke Engligh perfectly and gave us great advice for trains and even helped us make dinner reservations at two great restaurants - Le Violin d'Ingres (near Eiffel, 26 zagat rated, $250/couple with bottle of wine and we were treated like kings) and nearby at Le bistrot d'Alycastre (cozy ambience, 1 block away, great food, $150/couple w bottle of wine). Another great spot to eat is Le Comptoir du Relais (1 block away, no reservations, 26 zagat rated). This hotel is in the center of everything and made it the trip so enjoyable. I would definitely return and have recommended it to other friends already!

Reviews.Title: “Tres Affordable Adorable”
Reviews.Author: goldilocks1360
Reviews.Content: My four sisters and I took two rooms that were beautifully decorated--not large--but just right for New York princesses (bathrooms immaculate). The staff was very helpful since only one of us took French in high school many years ago--they told us when walking was more appropriate than the Metro, taxi or bus (e.g. the Louvre), recommended well-priced restaurants near and far and were very helpful when our map skills waned. The staff is friendly yet extremely professional. Very cozy.. very French yet well priced. Five Goldilockses

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous location, very attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: JeffStranks
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at K&K on Boulevard Raspail but decided to try here for a 2-night stay after arriving from Rio and before heading south. The location is fantastic for sights and restaurants and just strolling in St Germain and St Sulpice, Mabillon etc. Unlike one reviewer, but like all the others, we found staff extremely helpful and attentive, especially at reception. We'd booked a 'superior room' and they told us we were being upgraded (to what I'm not sure) and we got room 7 which had a small sitting area as well as en-suite and large bed. Very quiet, very comfortable. Still not exactly huge but that's Paris for you. Breakfast is a buffet-style affair with good quality food. Recommended as a very comfortable place in a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful! Look no further.”
Reviews.Author: Dollface10
Reviews.Content: Saying that we are picky travelers is an understatement, and after extensive research we decided on this lovely hotel and were not disappointed. The hotel itself is tastefully decorated and has modern amenities. Spacious rooms and a hip lounge area with an honesty bar. This is my second time to Paris and this is by far THE best neighborhood. The hotel is in a great location. Most importantly, the staff is gracious and extremely helpful. Paris was the first part of our 2 week vacation and when I left my ipod in the safe, they took extra measures to ensure that I received it before departing home to the US. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a chic closet”
Reviews.Author: R20007
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay for 5 nights, but also stayed for 4. Our first room was so small we couldn't open the door without moving our luggage. The shower was stopped up - not clean! We moved to a second room, a "junior suite," when the lights blew out in the first. The "suite" was slightly bigger, but I would have been pretty upset if I had to pay for the difference. As for the staff, serious attitude. The night manager was not friendly or helpful. The day manager was not much better. In fact, I heard a couple of guests complain about the night manager to the day manager, who didn't seem very concerned. I asked the day manager to write down the name of a restaurant. His response: " Okay, but I think it's pretty easy to remember." The hotel is located in a pricey area although it's pretty convenient. In summary, the hotel is expensive, miniature in the extreme, and needs a staff attitude overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of St. Germain”
Reviews.Author: Will7528
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of a two week European vacation, and absolutely loved this hotel. After a rather arduous experience returning our rental car to Gare du Nord, Hotel Odeon was a pleasant spot to relax and refresh before setting our sights on Paris. The gentleman at the front desk was so helpful, setting us up with restaurant reservations, directions and even mailing the wine we picked up in the Loire Valley. The hotel is beautifully appointed with, as my wife says, plush fabrics and Parisien ambiance. The rooms are small, but that's to be expected, and the elevator is tiny but its all manageable. St. Germain de Pres is a great neighborhood for window shopping, restaurants and getting away from the touristy vibe of some of Paris' other neighborhoods. It's clear this hotel deserves to be among the top 50 hotels in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Typical and charming french hotel”
Reviews.Author: sylviaaasmiles
Reviews.Content: Matthew at the front desk was extremely helpful and considerate, and cordial. The rooms are beautiful and everything is very sanitary and clean. Breakfast was absolutely delicious, with a nice french flair to everything in sight. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the designer has gone for a romantic look that means no lightbulb is more than 40 watts!”
Reviews.Author: ZorraLondon
Reviews.Content: My advice is bring a flashlight to a) read, b) do your make-up and c) inspect the cleaning standards. Oh, and bring some white gloves to check the major dust bunnies in hard to reach but very visible places like the top of the radiator, and if you get the single room I had, don't drop your soap because the shower stall is SO small you have to open the door and back out in order to lean over. And as they do not provide you with a soap dish in the shower, the likelihood of dropping your soap is extremely high! I went out to Muji and bought myself a travel soap dish that works with suction cups. I'm afraid I didn't leave it there for the next guest. That said, staff were very charming and tried to be helpful, and the decor is nice if you like plush.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel--a comfortable refuge after a long day out on the town”
Reviews.Author: AdrienneChicago
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a room with two twin beds and were pleasantly surprised that that's what we got. Our pleasant room faced the small, yet busy street, and had tall french door/windows that opened for fresh air when needed but when closed, kept out the street noises. The room was elegantly decorated with quality textiles and we had a settee, two side tables and a small writing table and stool in the room other than the beds, which were very comfortable indeed, with quality bedding. We had four lamps with dimmers and two reading lights, which made the room pleasantly lit. The bathroom was small but well appointed with a tub/shower and l'Occitaine toiletries/soaps. very nice. Large bath towel/sheets were a welcome luxury. The front desk staff couldn't have been more helpful, friendly and attentive. They were there for our every need in English and in French. There is a well functioning elevator and a nice little entry area/living room to receive guests or to have a drink from the honor bar. We didn't have breakfast in, but it did look good. One day we had coffee in our room for just a few euros. The hotel is withing walking distance of many restaurants, bars and Gerard Mulot patisserie, one of, if not the best, patisserie in Paris, where we procured croissants and such every a.m. for breakfast. There is also a Starbucks for those who are addicted, just a stone's throw over on Blvd. St. Germain. Walk to the market on Rue de Buci (just ask if you can't find it) and to Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, Rue Mouffetard, and to Pont Neuf for the boats that cruise down the Seine. Musee D'Orsay is also within walking distance. I will return to Hotel Odeon Saint Germain for future trips for sure and would recommend it to others. It's terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Staff, Nice Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Maymcclurg
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel from the reviews on Trip Advisor. Everything I read and experienced was true to the reviews! Friendly staff, good location to the Metro, charming rooms etc. Matthew, was our main concierge/contact at the hotel and he was extremely helpful and charming! St. Germain is an amazing neighborhood in Paris! For anyone who is interested in great mouthwatering seafood and a super friendly environment-go to Fish on St. Suplice! Another restuarant I found on Trip Advisor that became our local watering hole! Tres Bien!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, warm welcome!”
Reviews.Author: winesipper2
Reviews.Content: Upon researching hotels in the 6th arrondissement, we came upon this one, which appeared to meet our criteria for location, metro stop, quiet street, breakfasts available, and reasonable price. Going to the website, we found there was a discounted room rate for a time, so that made it even more attractive. What sealed the deal was noting that it was a "Fodor's Choice" hotel. We do not know anyone who has stayed here, but we will certainly recommend it to our friends. The concierge Matthieu was especially helpful and welcoming. Our room was on the street side, but very well soundproofed. there was adequate storage, and the bathroom was clean and complete, though small. The cleaning and serving staff people were lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: des14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and the staff are extremely helpful and very nice. I was traveling with my 8 year old daughter and we both felt welcome and well taken care of. The room was very comfortable and clean - and the decor was just great. I can't say enough about the location - just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky with a capital "Q"”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: This was the third time I stayed at Odeon St Germain and I will continue to come here when I’m staying in Paris. The staff are professional, warm, knowledgable, and accommodating. The hotel is in a great location, just around the corner from a wonderful bakery and all the other attractions in the 6th. Despite being in the center of Paris, the rooms (at least the ones I've stayed in) are quiet. It’s been relatively recently renovated and is decorated in a style more classic than trendy. The bathrooms are completed updated, the bed is comfortable, and everything is well maintained and very clean. The only criticism I have—and it’s not enough to keep me from coming back--is that the rooms are rather dark. Given the layout of the building, there’s little natural light, even though all three rooms I’ve stayed in have at least 2 windows. The bathroom lighting is fine, but the lighting in the rooms themselves is rather dim, even though there are bedside LED reading lights. Now for the quirkiness—this is a large part of Odeon St Germain’s charm, but it may not be for everyone. Apparently all the rooms have different layouts—and none of them are the standard rectangular or square shape. Rooms are smallish—one room I stayed in (on the least expnsive end) had barely enough room for a bed and desk—but are designed to make the most of the limited space. Again, this quirkiness may not be for everyone, but is probably what makes some of us fans— I never know what’s going to be behind the door, but I know it will be delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel , Best location , perfect point to start Paris visiting”
Reviews.Author: kenanWhite
Reviews.Content: it was my first visit to Paris, I choose this hotel based on trip advisor reviews and everything was the same the staff very cool specific JEAN at the reception like to help all the time , and also they help me to start my visit by give me tips . the hotel was near everything restaurant, coffee bars and to the attractive places and historical places . it's small hotel elegant decoration , a very clean rooms , and special things at the middle of all the crowed of Paris you will find this hotel with the best quiet rooms to sleep .

Reviews.Title: “Nice and charming”
Reviews.Author: Ruby024
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with a very nice staff (Paris is changing). My room was quite small but conformable and well decorated. Even travel solo I decided to upgrade to a larger room. Bathroom was really too small. Breakfast was quite good even if plain but with well-chosen items. The location is one of the best in Paris. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice if you want to be in the middle of it all...”
Reviews.Author: Besuhoff
Reviews.Content: I've staid in more than a dozen of hotels in Paris (including really expensive ones like Le Meurice) and this is the one I liked the most so far. If you like the Odeon/St.Germain area, then the location does not get any better than this. The hotel itself is a typical Parisian hotel - quite small lobby/lounge and rooms. However, it is very tastily decorated, feels relatively new and clean, the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. And then there is the small things that really make you feel good about the place - like the toiletries by L'Occitance and free wify. Our only issue was the price. We felt that it was rather overpriced for what it was (we paid an equivalent of a 4-5 star hotel) but if you're willing to go along with that in exchange for knowing that you'll have a good experience, then it may be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Raptor145
Reviews.Content: Our concierge, Matthew, was great. He was friendly, helpful and knowlegeable of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Olijaz
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the great reviews for a birthday treat for my girlfriend, and it certainly got me some brownie points, we were both very impressed, the location, staff, rooms are all superb, if we return to Paris (which we hope to soon) we will certainly be booking this hotel again. top marks.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Comfort, Convenient Location, Cordial Staff”
Reviews.Author: DDU56
Reviews.Content: Fodor's gave the Odeon Saint-Germain a starred recommendation, so I booked it for my spring break tour with my daughter, a college student studying abroad. The superior double room -- in a gloriously upfitted old building -- was small but oozing with chic, and the bath was even smaller but equipped with l'Occitane toiletries, fluffy towels and terry robes. In true Parisian fashion, the hotel even provided a wine corkscrew. Our room on an upper floor was a quiet haven in the bustling Saint-Germain district. The location is only a 15-minute walk across the Pont Neuf to the Louvre, convenient to the Luxembourg Gardens, and within easy reach of a Metro station and other transport options. Cafes, pharmacies, and shops abound. We skipped the expensive hotel breakfast and contented ourselves with fresh croissants and quiches from nearby boulangeries. The charming staff treated all guests cordially, spoke English fluently, and helped with every request, particularly our need to stow luggage after check-out pending our departure later in the day. I happily recommend the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain to travelers seeking a soothing and stylish oasis in busy Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: poolepunter
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the hotel, arriving on Tuesday and departing on Friday. We were made most welcome and felt at home and comfortable straight away. The staff's English put my attempts to speak French to shame. We were upgraded to a superior room, and whilst it was still relatively small, it had everything we needed. There was more than enough storage space, somewhere to sit, a good shower with plenty of hot water and an extremely comfortable bed. The room was very clean and tastefully furnished. I can not really fault the hotel; having read other reviews we knew what to expect and were not disappointed. The location is great with Metro stations close by and numerous restaurants and bars within easy walking distance. We plan to return to Paris again, and will not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel,chic and well positioned.”
Reviews.Author: PoitiersDavid
Reviews.Content: We visit paris every year.Mr Lemoin and the team gave us a warm welcome from entering until leaving the hotel. Executive room well equiped,size adequate.Would have liked a little more available light in the main room,and also tea or coffee facility.In the bathroom there is a need for a shower holder on the wall......but these are MINOR quibbles.We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Friendly Front of house staff/ Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: supernova4444
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner for 3 nights, my first trip to Paris her 3rd. On the second day she asked what was my favorite thing in Paris so far and i said Michael the front of house concierge who we met on arrival. Having had a preconceived idea that french attitudes were a little rude to visitors, he was the most friendly, polite, helpful, and humorous hotel staff member i have met, and i once spent 3 years on a performing tour in and out of hotels every second day so have a fair amount of experience. We were given a complementary upgrade to a room with a sitting room, it was lovely to have to be able to come home and relax in with a nice wine and i will book a room with this on my next stay knowing what i do now . The room was very clean and comfortable, my girlfriend is a stickler for hygiene and she had no complaints. I am told all Paris rooms are smallish so we were prepared for this and decided on this hotel for the location which was excellent. There is a metro station about 1 min walk from hotel, easy to get anywhere you want although we walked most places inc all the major tourist spots as it was my first Paris trip. We never ate at the hotel as on a bit of a tighter budget so cant comment but there are shops within 4-5 mins to get all you need for a day trip, baguettes, cheese, wine if you need to do it that way too and hotel staff will happily help you find them. Michael helped us find a nice restaurant, good live jazz club and lots of other little tips. I would say anyone thinking of going to the crazy horse save your money very underwhelming more an Asian tourist joint than top end dancing and entertainment, big disappointment for us. Also i walked the catacombs which is in all the to do books but i found it to be a bit overrated.. mind you i was a little hung over not the best time i guess. All in all, we will defiantly be staying here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent surprise”
Reviews.Author: isil_81
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on its location, which prooved to be perfect. It is right in the middle of cafes and restaurants and nightlife and it it also extremely close to all the major sightseeing locations. The metro station it less than one minute walking distance and you can walk to many of the Paris attractions including the Louvre and Musee D'Orsay. The neighborhood is lively, full of students and tourists and very safe even late at night. The hotel itself has suprised us as we had been expecting a very small room but our room was spacious enough and it was well decorated with small but elegant little details. The room and the bathroom were very clean, the bed was extremely confortable and the staff very friendly and helpful. Overall we have had no complaints during our visit and will definetely go back to this hotel for our future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect surprise birthday present!”
Reviews.Author: Venetiar
Reviews.Content: I booked the Odeon Saint-Germain as a suprise 30th birthday present for my boyfriend, I had scoured the internet reading reviews over and over again. But I went with this hotel - and I am so glad I did! On arrival we were greeted by Matthew, who was fanastic for our entire stay, recommending all sorts of places for our tastes and style, and he got it spot on. Not only was the service fantastic but we were also upgraded to a junior suite which was such a lovely gesture. This is the perfect hotel if you wish to have an intimate romantic stay with a partner, the rooms are small but perfectly formed. But I have to say that it was Matthew who really made the stay 10 out of 10! Thank you very much. We will deffinitely return for my birthday suprise - I hope! All the best Venetia and Luke (London)

Reviews.Title: “Cahrm and comfort in the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: rk1400
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain is a lovely hotel set in the lively Saint Germain area of Paris. The hotel is chic and comfortable and every attention has been paid to the details - from the little things such as the accessories and toiletries in the bathrooms to the quality of the decor throughout. The rooms are all different - but not so affectedly so that you feel like you are being hit over the head by stylists - so you don't get that feeling that guests are just numbers to be processed. This goes for how you are treated by the staff as well. The public areas as attractive and the breakfast, although limited, is good and the coffee excellent. You can't fault access to Eurostar - straight down Line 4, it takes about 15 minutes. The only consideration would be the lift which is the smallest I've ever encountered and, while functional, you will get to know your fellow guests better than you might otherwise excpet.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hoss77
Reviews.Content: St-Germain area of Paris is a good area for tourism as well as dining with locals, lots of cafes. Close to subway, boating on Seine or just walking. We wouldn`t hesitate to come back here again. The breakfast was different that North American standards but we found it plentiful and enjoyable.Next time we would spend more time eating in cafes there rather than chase what we thought would be better restaurants elsewhere in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Fleetcat
Reviews.Content: Really not sure why this hotel would be 16th in Paris . It is an absolutely fine glorified bed and breakfast (you pay additional cost for breakfast though) in a great location. The staff are lovely and unlike a previous poster we found the French on a charm offensive (or perhaps they just couldn’t bear to hear me massacring their language) and many – particularly in this hotel - were helpful speaking English. We paid for an upgraded room and it was incredibly tiny. The TV reception was poor. The bathroom a converted cupboard with a horrid shower curtain. Reasonable mini bar. The whole however was very expensive for what it offers. We moved to the Champs Elysees Plaza and it was similarly priced but a different league.

Reviews.Title: “if you think france is ok. this will do fine too.”
Reviews.Author: VanTongeren
Reviews.Content: But i don't like france at all. everywere you go arrogant service. they very often don't speak english and that is because don't care. but now i'm complaining about the french in general. in this hotel they did speak english. but...well not in a prout way, you know. the rooms were very french. small that is. and the prices didn't match. but it was cosy and clean. in a nice area so. would i recommend? i, think yes. but only if you can't be talked out of going to Paris in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: HKTravels
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews on Trip Advisor, I selected this hotel for its location and value. We stayed in a room on the 3rd floor. The location is fantastic and is very close to many lovely restaurants, bistros and shopping areas. It was very easy to walk around, and also close to a metro stop. As expected for Paris, the room was very small, and luckily only one of us had a large suitcase. The bathroom is also quite compact, but there was lots of hot water with great water pressure which isn't always the case in Paris Hotels. Our rate did not include breakfast (14 euros per person for breakfast seems a little steep), and there are many cafes less than 5 mins walk from the hotel. If you have trouble with stairs, it will be worth checking with reservations which room they will give you as the lift does not always take you directly to your floor - to get to the lift we needed to go up one flight of stairs which is fine for us. Overall, we had a great stay at Hotel Odeon St Germain as the location was perfect, rooms were clean with lovely decor and staff were helpful with room reservations, booking taxis etc. We would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you don't need space”
Reviews.Author: tdstravels
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights there and thought the staff was great (english speaking and helpful). The location was very good...short walk to busy neighborhood spots to shop and eat. The room was tight and the only complaint would be the size of the bathroom facilities. The tub and shower were tiny...tub too short for even my wife to sit in and the shower head to low for me to stand under. If you are aware of these limitatations and are ok with them then you will probably like staying here. Also, our junior suite was on the top floor and the ceiling slanted over the bed, so one of us had to bend over at the waist to get in and out of bed...usually with a bump on the head in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: BambiTelaviv
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel when staying in Paris ! Exceptional location, Attentive staff and designed beautifuliy, This is, no doubt, one of the best hotels we ever stayed at in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DaveMadrid
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. As good, or better, than the pictures. The reception with fireplace is very cozy...and we had tea there late at night by ourselves...felt as though it was a rented house. Very classy, chic, decor throughout. Very comfortable, clean, rooms and bathrooms. Excellent location...great, helpful, staff. Incredibly, the receptionist was even able to unlock our suitcase because we lost the key!!! If I had to find one fault, it would be with room service breakfast... They never got the order right...and they expect you to use the same cup for tea as for cereal!! But this is a minor point, corrected by a few more phone calls. Overall, a very good experience and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “an ideal hotel .....”
Reviews.Author: irapap
Reviews.Content: perfect location.about 200 metres from boulevard st.germain.. very friendly staff which helped us very much with information about our first time in paris .we reserved a luxury room which was about 20 sq and very elegant decoration and a very comfortable bathroom..small but very cosy hotel it is certain that we would stay again..

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience, from reservation to check-out!”
Reviews.Author: RachelRio
Reviews.Content: From my first contact with reservations, through the check-out, the management of the Odéon Saint-Germain was friendly, courteous, helpful in all matters, and extremely efficient. The room – and the whole hotel -was tastefully decorated and well-appointed. An atmosphere of old Paris with all the modern amenities. Breakfast was delicious and beautifully served. The location could not be better. On a quiet street in the heart of Saint Germain, close to Place St. Suplice and the Odéon metro stop, with great restaurants and bakeries and cafés and bistros and food markets and fantastic shops in every direction - not to mention very close walking distance to the Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame, and the Orsay and Louvre Museums.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem - chic, luxurious and affordable”
Reviews.Author: pantouffleGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from four day trip to Paris staying at Hotel Odeon. Its a really fantastic hotel - our room was large by Parisian standards, beautifully furnished and well-equipped. The reception staff are marvellous - genuinely friendly and totally attentive. The interiors are chic and stylish, yet cosy and romantic. This hotel is a real gem - we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Chic & Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Johnwinter
Reviews.Content: This small Hotel surpassed our exceptions! The staff (esp. Matthew & Jean) were superb in ervery way; helpful in english for reservations, directions and recommendations. The hotel decor was very chic with expensive fabrics/linens both in the rooms and in lobby and breakfast area. Rooms were very clean, romantic, and quite from the active little street. The real surprise was the location was with in walking distance to dozens of superb restaurants, the Seine, Louvre, D'Orsay, The Metro, Notre Dame, a Theater, Luxembourg Park, the youthful bars/pubs/pizza shops around St. Sulpice and shopping. This 6th arrondisemont area was a special treat (we can understand why the great artists and writers did) and so glad we picked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and charming hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: marym1
Reviews.Content: Walking into this hotel on a cold, rainy day in October after a long trip from New York, I felt immediately welcomed by the staff. They were very helpful during the entire stay of five days (was there for business). The beds were so comfortable and room was clean. The bathroom was quite small as was the closet, but living in New York it was not surprising to me. My only complaint was that even though the wifi was free, it was so slow which made it almost unusable for work. There is a hard wired connection available too if needed. Overall though I loved the neighborhood and because my stay here was very pleasant, I would certainly consider returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nabitabilo
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely responsive especially given our very limited French language skills.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DeanStef
Reviews.Content: Excellent location/hotel to stay while visiting Paris. Staff was very courteous and helpful day and night. Rooms were very well decorated with flat screen and full, updated bathroom. Amenities were excellent and they met or exceeded our expectations. A great, central location for great meals, sightseeing, banking, etc. -- very close to metro and other stores. You would do well to consider this hotel in the 6th district as opposed to others in the tourist areas of 7 and 8. This area had a much better "Parisian feel" and more variety of shopping/dining locations.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could speak better French so that I could tell these folks how much we appreciated everything!”
Reviews.Author: durangotravelers
Reviews.Content: First of all, when you are an American in Paris there is a bit of intimidation that occurs. Especially if you speak the language as poorly as I do. However, the folks at Hotel Odeon, St. Germain made it okay to practice my lousy French on them! (especially Mattieu) and I so appreciated his acceptance of us. They seemed to know right when we were ready to just give up and speak English and then help us out -- priceless. I traveled with my friend and we had a room with two twins - and it was perfect. Great showers. Great wine. And breakfast!? Wonderful. Coffee fantastic. Stay here. It will be a highlight of your trip. The location is unmatched - always come back to the 6th district for food - you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MrStylz
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this gem. We had read the reviews and booked a great rate a few weeks prior to leaving. Upon arrival, we were helped with our bags from the taxi and promptly checked in with no issues. The rooms were sized proportionally to Paris so it was exactly as we were expecting - small and necessities only. It was a tad tight for a suitcase and large backpack but we made due. They seemed to have larger rooms but we just booked smallest. My wife really liked the toiletries that this hotel uses - apparently something on the higher end? The room was always very clean and well kept. The beds were comfortable. The location is amazing - so close to great cafes, Metro, RER, and some great sites. We were always no more than 20 minutes from ANY site in the city - even with metro changes. I'd highly recommend this place for tourists. We had an interior room and it was extremely quiet at night - which was very nice. We did not do the breakfast option as there were so many nice cafe's to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flyingporcupine
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay in Odeon Saint Germain. I was very pleased! The hotel style is boutiquey and very plush. Breakfast had a great variety, and the beds were very comfy. Upon arrival I was upgraded to an executive room, with a large double bed and walk in wardrobe. Staff were very friendly, informative and patient when I attempted a few words of French! The only downside (which didn't bother me but could bother some guests) is that the hotel and room were both quite dark. Responding to the review below, I also stayed in room 30 after being upgraded from a single room. I didn't notice any mould in the bathroom, and found the bathroom quite large overall. The shower holder fell off the wall but was fixed immediately after I reported it. The room was smaller than most others I've stayed in, but was ample space for me (although I was a solo traveller unlike the previous review). There was a running fountain outside my window but this was turned off at night so did not bother me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, small dark rooms...”
Reviews.Author: SBFINCT
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location in a great Paris neighborhood. Many shops, bars and restaurants right outside the door. The lobby is very nice and check in is easy because it is a small hotel. Sadly though, we didn't enjoy our five day stay from Sept 10-15, 2009. We were told that we were given and "upgrade to an Executive room". This was complete NONSENSE. We were given Room 30, which faces a courtyard. Avoid this room completely. If this is an upgrade, then I am afraid to see the other rooms. Room 30 is small, dark and faces a tiny interior courtyard. I can't imagine a smaller room for two people. The bathroom is stuffy as there is no ventilation whatsoever. The bathroom was moldy. The courtyard as a very loud water fountain which woke us up several mornings. We asked for it to be turned off completely and of course, it was not in the morning. Overall, for the price, there are better places to stay in this wonderful Paris neighborhood. I would not return to this hotel--ever. Look into other options.

Reviews.Title: “Number One Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EnchantedTravel999
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent 4 wonderful nights at the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain in the last week of August 2009. The location the hotel was fabulous - right in the midst of Saint-Germain, Paris' cultural and fashion hub. We were 2 minutes walking distance from Boulevard Saint Germain - where Les Deux Margots, Le Brasserie Lippe and many other literary haunts are located. Rue Saint-Sulpice is in itself a gorgeous street with numerous charming boutiques and crosses Rue Boneparte where the famous patissirie, Pierre Hermes is located. Our room was a double deluxe, facing the street. It wasn't huge but quite large for Parisian standards and was furnished tastefully. We enjoyed the silver service breakfast we ordered as room service a few days running. A major highlight for us was the every helpful staff - restaurant recommendations, maps detailing 'how to get to' certain places, google maps directions on how to arrive at our next destination post-Paris (Brugges). Nothing was too much trouble. The most helpful staff I encountered during my 4 week European vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler to Paris, I am always looking for the perfect boutique hotel. I finally found it! Situated in the midst of St. Germain's restaurants and shopping is this little jewel. The staff is gracious, the lobby is beautiful and welcoming -the perfect place for a quiet meeting, the breakfast buffet is bountiful and most importantly, the rooms are quiet and well done. Of course the rooms are small, as one would expect in a boutique hotel in Paris. However, they are well appointed with the latest flat screen, free wifi, a great bed, and lovely ammenities. The photos on their website are very accurate. Not a single complaint from me (almost unheard of!).

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: JeanneMichelle
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I spent a few nights in Paris this August. After hours of research (literally) we had made the decision to book our reservation at the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain. I am so glad that we did! It really is a lovely little hotel. The room, though small, was beautifully appointed. The 'closet' was extremely tiny! Our room did not come with a bathtub, but the shower was newly renovated with very pretty blue mosaic tiles, with great water pressure. We had no problem with the hot water supply either! The front desk personnel were very helpful and quite gracious. Finally, the location of the hotel, in the 6th, is perfect--we walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely hotel, Matthieu at front dest very helpfull.”
Reviews.Author: loverofparis
Reviews.Content: I would love to go back there and I would reccommend it highly. It is decorated so nicely with French fabrics. The rooms are very clean and a little on the small side, as are most rooms in Paris. Front desk is very helpfull during the day, but at night there was a little language problem, if you speak English, but everyone tried anyway. This is a little gem. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous hotel”
Reviews.Author: noorMadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for seven nights. Beautiful hotel, perfectly located. Beautiful neighbourhood. You could walk everywhere. Really quiet (you could sleep with windows open and don't hear a noise!). Friendly and kind staff. We stayed at a deluxe room really beautiful and clean. Big bed, big wardrobe, 2 windows, comfortable and a beautiful bathroom too. Perfect size for both the room and the bathroom. I can't say anything bad about the hotel. Simply perfect. We'll go back for sure. No doubt about it. In fact, we're looking forward to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tobylulu
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time. The room was absolutely prceious. We were in room 6, a junior suite, and loved everything. The breakfast in the AM was nice and plentiful. Everything appeared clean and fresh. We never came across many other guests which was kind of nice. The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. If we were to ever go back we would no doubt stay there. Oh & the fact that it had air was a plus as we hit a 97 degree heat wave the week we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Walshette
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the left bank area of Paris, room was gorgeous, very cosy and romantic with lovely touches such as chocolates in your room and loccitaine products! In fantastic location, close to some great restaurants and really handy to louvre and notre dame, also couple of metro stations nearby as was the rer station which brings you to the airport. would stay again when next in paris!

Reviews.Title: “Small is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Walk_the_walk
Reviews.Content: The Odeon Saint Germain just proves that small is beautiful. We have just spent 3 nights at the hotel and, as previous reviewers have commented, although our superior/executive room (12) was not large (and the en suite was not just small, it was tiny) it was impeccably clean and the bed very comfortable. All the staff were helpful (with a smile, which was welcome). We had been concerned when we first got to the room that there would be street noise as the room overlooked Rue St Sulpice but we need not have worried, the double windows took care of any noise and the air con kept the room temperature down (30 degrees C is no joke in Paris). The friends we travelled with were given one of the rooms (29) at the back of the hotel which did not get much natural light, this meant that their room was gloomy. But they felt it was not a huge issue as they did not mean to spend a great deal of time in the room during the day. The buffet continental breakfast was good value at Eur14 (the croissants and pain au chocolat were particularly good), hot dishes were available at a supplement but we didn’t try them. If what you want is a comfortable, quiet base in St Germain which is within 50 metres of a variety of restaurants and bars, look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: DallasGirlOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked Hôtel Odéon Saint-Germain after reading the excellent reviews on tripadvisor. We stayed for five nights and couldn’t have been happier with the choice. The room and bath were very nice. We were so surprised by how quiet our room was! We couldn’t hear any street noise, which was perfect for a romantic getaway. It has a small sitting area (two chairs and a table), two closets, a comfortable bed, safe and updated bath. The hotel also had a small computer in the common area that guests could use for free. The hotel was conveniently located to everything. It was an easy walk to the Odeon metro stop and there were several wonderful restaurants just steps from the hotel. We had some of our best meals right in the neighborhood. We didn’t eat at the hotel, but a breakfast was offered for approx. $11 euros. It looked good, but we usually found a cute café on our way to see the sights. The staff was very friendly and was more than happy to make dining reservations, arrange for transportation, and give directions. We would stay at the Hôtel Odéon Saint-Germain again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LVSaint
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend the extra money after reading glowing reviews on this site. Was not disappointed. A few minutes walk from the useful Odeon Metro stop but far away enough on a fairly peaceful street a steps away from the magnificent St Sulpice church. Rooms are very tastefully decorated and arranged. Good lighting, nice TV, comfortable bed. Bathroom - excellent. Very classy, great working shower! Free wifi worked perfectly (from 1st floor up). No trouble with outside noise (there wasn't that much anyway) with extra double glazed full length windows. Walls thick enough to not be troubled by louder guests. No balcony - shame. Stayed in an 'executive' room which is maybe larger than standard and and the chaise lounge converting to bed which we need for three of us in the room. There is a safe and mini bar (not that we needed either), well the fridge might have been nice. We only discovered it as we were leaving as the 'secret' closet door looked like the interior paneling! Main manager very personable and helpful. Can't comment on breakfast as there are plenty of cafes around the corner adjacent to Odeon Metro stop offering affordable coffee and pastries. All in all, a great centrally located and comfortable base for Paris and far enough away from the St Michel jungle a few blocks away. A bit pricey but not out of line considering it's Paris and you're getting a lot more satisfaction than cheaper places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “My hotel in Paris for future visits”
Reviews.Author: mmsilva
Reviews.Content: A refined hotel with excellent amenities, in a central location. Staff is very helpful. Nicely decorated rooms, excellent for a romantic trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff - and great with our two year old.”
Reviews.Author: BelJCG
Reviews.Content: Finally a hotel where we weren't made to feel like lepers for having a two year old in tow! My husband (in our pre-parents days) and I have stayed in Paris many times, and although for things such as room-size this wasn't our no.1, as far as being welcomed into the hotel the customer service we found here far exceeded any other Parisien hotel we've stayed in. Practically, the room wouldn't have suited people who like a bit of space with their hotel! Although nicely furnished (with good smellies in the bathroom) it was small both in the main room and in the bathroom - I must have looked like a type of comedy routine as I tried to move my 6 month pregnant body around the bath! But we didn't care about this because it was spotless and looked lovely. Thankfully - given this area of Paris is pretty busy (felt like the west end of London to me) - this hotel is not on a main road but a side street. Can't really comment about road noise as it was blocked off for works when we stayed so no noise at all! It was convenient though for doing things - our little girl loved the Luxembourg gardens (complete with baby pools & sandpits, but very ornate & beautiful for the rest), and there were many restaurants to choose from in the evening. It's on the direct tube from the Gare de Nord station for the Eurostar (about 20 mins) and a long walk from the river, but do-able. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “great location but quite overpriced”
Reviews.Author: helia_bunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in the Odeon and had two rooms - a double and a triple. Overall, we liked the hotel and we're happy we stayed there. The location of the hotel is great - very close to the latin quarter and walking distance from Notre Dame. Lots of cafes everywhere. The service was nice and it has a nice boutique feel However, the triple room turned out to be a regular room with an extra bed which made it very tight. The rooms are really quite small and not all that nice given the price we payed. We've travel a lot in Europe so we know that rooms are small in any hotel, but give the price of 170 for the single and 210 for the double (which was discounted) we were expecting a nicer room and maybe somewhat larger. Next time, we would probably shop around a bit more and find a hotel that is better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Havelock-Karlson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris several times before, mostly on stopovers between Asia and South America. Of all the hotels, this one had by far the best location - combined with cleanliness, nice rooms and beds and friendliest staff I have found in a Parisien hotel. I honestly can't recomend this hotel enough. Our room was of a good size, on the first (second for non-Europeans) floor. I was worried that there might be some street noise, but Rue St Sulpice is surprisingly quiet. In every direction from the hotel there is something interesting within a few blocks. North you have the Seine and Notre Dame, East is Blvd St Michel - with some excellent bookshops (in English!), South is the Jardin Luxemburg and West is St Sulpice itself. Not the cheapest option - but you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: hkcjmc
Reviews.Content: This was the second stop on a mother-daughter trip to London, Paris, Rome, and Sorrento. It was our first trip to Paris. The hotel was nice; it looks Parisian from the moment you walk in the door. Great colors! The reception area is small and dark and they have a computer with free internet access. The problem for me was that they had a French keyboard. Found it easier to use the free wi-fi from the room. A very nice breakfast in the mornings. The women who worked the breakfast service were very sweet. The room was adequate for our needs. Great chocolates at turn down and L'occitane products in the little bathroom. Tiny elevator that scared us--use the stairs if you can! Cute shops and lots of cafes nearby..easy walk to Notre Dame and the Metro. We didn't find the staff at the reception desk to be especially helpful. They weren't bad, but didn't go out of their way to help us. They couldn't make change for us...and neither could/would the nearby bank (very convenient!), or crepe place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Daxselle
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Odeon Saint-Germain hotel for 9 nights in July. The staff was courteous, polite and accommodating. The hotel is situated on a quiet street with nearby dining and boutique shops. The area that surrounds the hotel is bustling but never touristy. The hotel is also a 5 minute walk to a very reliable and safe metro. The rooms were a good size and graciously appointed. The rooms were also spotless. Housekeeping did an outstanding job each day and when we would return to the room; it would look brand new. The concierge was particularly helpful. We were able to arrange several excursions and met our every request. There were absolutely no issues with the hotel the entire time that we stayed. It was truly a perfect getaway. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. If you are looking for a quaint, family-run hotel that offers superb service in the heart of the 6th arrondisment, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again, in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: latgreen37
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and the staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was complete and served by a competent server who was most anxious to please. The management was co-operative with directions to places of interest. This hotel is well-situated and easy to get to any attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: AppleEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Booked an executive room but i'm not sure exactly what that word means to them as the room was very small, dark and no view. Beware if you are single as they tend to give you the smallest and worst room possible in the category you've booked. The bathroom and bath products were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice staff”
Reviews.Author: fun2travel63
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this lovely small hotel on our first trip to Paris. The location is just wonderful--close to so many charming cafes and shops. The staff were welcoming and friendly. They helped us make reservations, arranged for taxis and gave directions with a wonderful attitude. Our deluxe room was nice and much larger than I thought it would be based on what I had read about Paris hotels. Our room faced the street and was quiet. We had a wonderful time and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming ... but dark!”
Reviews.Author: chaos
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel and a very efficient welcome; we'd emailed to say we'd be arriving about midnight and that wasn't a problem at all. We were shown to our room (32) which was decorated with beautiful fabrics and crisp white bedding, the bathroom was small but beautifully fitted and very clean (and also had lovely l'occitaine shower gel & shampoo!) We also had an area to the right of the bottom of the bed, with a table and two chairs which was draped with even more fabric. A lovely spot for breakfast in your bathrobes! The man on reception was able to recommend somewhere nearby we could still get something to eat, which was really helpful. The only niggle is that I really feel unsettled in gloomy rooms; when I booked I requested a double rather than a twin (which we got) and a room with plenty of natural light (which we didn't!) There wasn't a window at all in the bedroom area or the bathroom. The only window was in the area where the table & chairs were. It had a heavy curtain & a net curtain, which I just had to open even though it looked out on to an air con unit! I still felt a bit claustrophobic, which was a shame because otherwise the room was lovely. It was only a 2 night stay, and it was a couple of bright days in July ... we're going back to Paris in October and I must admit I couldn't stay here again then because it would just be too gloomy. The layout of the hotel suggests that most rooms don't have great views or are particularly bright. If that doesn't bother you, then I'd absolutely recommend this hotel. My partner loved the room but even he said he wouldn't be keen to stay in the same room again. Also, the maids were cleaning the rooms either side of us from about 8:30am on the Sunday morning; it would have been fine, but they'd left the doors open so they could carry on chatting & laughing and even bashing the hoover against our door ... which did get slightly irritating after an hour or so! It's in a lovely location, a really easy walk from Odeon metro, and loads of bars and restaurants within a very short walk. I've only marked down the "service" and "room" section because of the maids who seemed oblivous to anyone who might have wanted to sleep in on the Sunday morning! And the room because it was just too gloomy for me. Otherwise it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that had everything right”
Reviews.Author: ParisParis_france
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for 5 days.I chose Hotel Odeon saint Germain from reviews in tripadvisor,and I fully concur that this hotel tried to please us in everyway.The rooms were beautifully furnished,spotlessly clean,not large but tastefully decorated.The bathroom was fairly large with all mod cons at our disposal.The front desk were extremely helpfull in every way and they seemed to go out of their way to help us with suggestins,cafes,tours to go on and directions on the underground.Having never been to Paris before I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jopebi
Reviews.Content: After thirty years of frequent travel to Paris we have found the best hotel we have ever stayed in -- or rather, lived in, for a week. A lovely, elegant yet comfortable decor penetrates everywhere, from the salon at the hotel's entrance (perfect for receiving friend's before an evening on the town), to the salle a manger where a delicious breakfast is available, to the rooms, of which there are maybe two dozen. We had two rooms on the fourth floor, arranged in a sort of suite, because we were four: my wife and I, and our children, 12 and 13. We were extremely comfortable, in every way. Air conditioning was efficient and unobtrusive. Bathrooms were lovely, uncluttered, and immaculate. We were on the street side but the double-pane windows kept it quiet as a Bentley. The staff -- in particular the three young men who rotate at the reception: Brice, Mathieu and Sebastien -- were attentive, extremely courteous and anxious to be of assistance. Though I speak fluent French, I often heard them speak English to other guests and on the phone, and their English is very good and can make Paris a lot more serviceable for those who do not speak French. One evening I asked Mathieu to make a reservation for us and some friends at a restaurant in the neighborhood -- 7 people in all. To my astonishment, he walked to the restaurant, spoke to the owner, and picked out the perfect table for us. Taxis, theatre tickets, tours, packages, recommendations -- I recommend they be relied upon, and I know they relish the opportunity to serve. I must say, also, that we were fortunate to be introduced, one day, to the owners of the hotel -- an exquisite, charming couple whose presence and conversation were a pleasure. They decorated the hotel, they selected the staff, and they have infused the hotel with their taste, knowledge and spirit. And the location? Get on your Google Earth or GPS and take a bird's-eye view. The heart of the heart of Paris: St. Germain-des-Pres, between the gorgeous Luxembourg Gardens two blocks south, the boulevard St. Germain two blocks to the north, and all around a classy neighborhood with a calmly vibrant nightlife, wonderful restaurants, shops and sites -- everything we wanted to do with the children in walking distance. This will henceforth be our home for our yearly trip to Paris. It should be yours.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of tranquility and elegance”
Reviews.Author: lizg718
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I spent a week in Paris in June. The hotel Odeon St. Germain was just wonderful. I had booked an executive twin but they upgraded us to a jr. suite at no extra charge. Our room was at the top of a spiral staircase. Very quiet with blackout shades; a plus in the long days of June. The staff was so accommodating with dinner reservations and all. Also, the location is perfect - about 2 blocks from the Odeon metro, walking distance to Notre Dame and the Luxenborg Gardens (our favorite) with lots of cafes nearby. Tip: if you have trouble with stairs ask for a ground level or street facing room. Otherwise there is no way to avoid the narrow spiral staircase for at least some of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but there are hundreds of others to choose from”
Reviews.Author: carpediemgypsy
Reviews.Content: Tiny room. Smelled smoke through the walls. Love St. Germain, but would stay elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: George610
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Went off of Tripadvisor reviews, and feel sure I did the right thing. Close to Carrefour Odeon 4 Métro line, Perfect for a morning jog in Luxembourg gardens and on the Isles. Shopping withing walking distance is great - Rue St Sulpice & Blvd St. Germain are both superb, Le Bon Marché is walkable, too. We took three rooms, double, executive, and single; if you can spend a little extra, go for the executive, although all three were great, and spotlessly clean. The beds are on the firm side, which we like. Double-glazed windows, individually controllable a/c. If you rely on internet/email, make sure you bring your computer - I believe they have wireless in the rooms for free. We didn't bring the computer, so had to use the one they had downstairs, which was rather slow and unpredictable (also, that French keyboard...) The buildings's bones are old, so don't expect a Hausmanian grandeur. Breakfast (downstairs or in your room) was optional, and, although not a bargain, still a great idea if you're in a hurry or can't face ordering yet another grand crème/viennoiserie. Very nice, attentive bilingual staff. Would go back in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Charming in a most Parisian way, friendly, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: billdollco
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel that feels like Paris; helpful staff, graciously made restaurant reservations. Wonderful location - easy walk to Seine even if the warren of lovely Parisian streets and alleys are hard to mentally map for a while), Cite, Luxembourg Gardens, Latin Q.. All kinds of stylish, inviting shops clothes, maps, prints, toiletries, she, shoes, shoes, etc; Almost countless cafes, food shops, always abuzz with happy, chatty, reading, necking couples. Rooms charming, but small -- but this is a centuries old building with many past lives, not a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Best of its kind in Paris”
Reviews.Author: eurotrippers
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit in two years to this hotel and I would probably always choose it if I could get in. It is tastefully furnished and the room was clean and comfortable. The aircon worked and nit was quiet despite the busy road outside. The bathroom was small but functional and it was a pleasure to have a bath after two weeks of showers. There was an excellent breakfast choice-ham and eggs as well as croissants etc. and there were plenty of good reataurants around. It is a tad expensive, but the quality shows through. You get what you pay for and it's worth it in the case of this very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Antinous96
Reviews.Content: My partner spent a wonderful June week in Paris this year and we were thrilled with this elegant little jewel of a hotel. The location is excellent being close to the Odeon Metro Station (direct line to Gare de Nord/Eurostar). You can also walk to all of the major attractions and dozens of wonderful restaurants and cafes. While the hotel is in the thick of things, it is situated in a quiet little side street so you really do avoid the noise. Check out the patisserie at the end of the street- amongst the best I have ever been to. The rooms are typically Parisian proportioned and are very elegantly furnished- we could not have asked for anything more. Housekeeping was impeccable, the front desk helpful and always polite- especially Matthieu, the bed incredibly comfortable, the air conditioning perfect- and the list goes on and on As soon as you enter the distinctively elegant little lobby and lounge you know you found yourself a lovely base from which to explore this enchanting city. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice little gem in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jackpotnyc
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel located in a great location. One can walk to major sites and all around are fantastic restaurants and bistros and cafes with elegant boutiques and all the necessities with Odeon subway station around the corner. In all it is a ideal hotel with all the comfort inside and outside with great staffs. Wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel - a real gem”
Reviews.Author: MCQC
Reviews.Content: We had two de luxe rooms (8 and 9) that could be closed off together, and so provided an ideal set up for a family. The rooms were fantastically furnished and very comfortable, although not massive and not cheap. The hotel itself is a real gem, located on the quiet rue St-Sulpice in the heart of the Left Bank. Most of the major attractions are in easy striking distance, but there are many excellent restaurants on the door step, and the beautiful Jardin De Luxembourg is only a short stroll away. The reception staff could not be more helpful. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: lmlm585
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Odeon Saint Germain. The hotel was very clean and centrally located, but on a quiet side street, which was wonderful. The neighborhood felt very safe and convenient, we walked back to the hotel late at night with never a worry. The room was beautiful, small but the layout made the most of the space. And the staff was very friendly and helpful. We had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay there again, and would recommend this to anyone looking for a fabulous small hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful Stay at Hotel Odeon”
Reviews.Author: CtLove2Travel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I jsut returned from a most wondeful stay at this wondeful hotel. The room was cozy and romatic and the staff very professional and msot pleasant. We are already looking forward to a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and yet clean, quiet and central”
Reviews.Author: elfelt
Reviews.Content: It was indeed a pleasure to stay at this newly redecorated hotel in the middle of the Latin Quarter. Around the corner, there are numerous small restaurants catering to the purse of nearly everyone. Besides this there are also many good shops.

Reviews.Title: “Quality + convenience = a wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: TNTK
