Reviews.Content: Two adults and three 20-year-olds stayed for six days. Loved the location, just steps from the Odeon Metro. Had three rooms--would advice to ask for upper floor rooms for more light. I had the bottom floor and my room was extremely dark. Staff was so helpful and nice--if you know Paris, you know how unusual that is! The hotel is small--rooms and furnishings are miniature--but its charming and luxurious and clean. Truly a 'Parisian' experience! We recommend the Odeon Saint Germain!

Reviews.Title: “Supreme location, nice furnishings,questionable value”
Reviews.Author: Dulcinea2009
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Odeon Saint Germain easily from CDG by train then metro to Saint Suplice and were able to walk with our luggage to the Hotel Odeon Saint Germain! What a breeze. To think we actually considered a cab from the airport! Being West Coast Americans, we were impressed with the ease of the public transportation! We arrived at the Odeon fairly early (9am from US) and were told the room was being cleaned. It would be ready in less than hour. We greatly appreciated that as we were jet lagged and eager to hit the hay. I had booked our "standard" room for E219 (euros) for the Wed and Thurs nights. Two days before our departure, I checked the hotel website and the rates had decreased to E169 per night. A fifty euro difference! I told this to the front desk man, who checked with the boss and they would NOT honor the current reduction in rates. This was a big disappointment for me as 100 euros ($140 US) is not insignificant to me. I asked if at least we could upgrade to a "superior" room instead of the "standard" which we had booked, as the "superior" was E214 per night when checked 2 days before arrival. They said indeed they would put us in the superior, but it was, alas, a standard. We did appreciate the nice elements to this hotel, and I thought the decor was thoughtful (husband couldn't have cared less-he thought the mattress lumpy though) but had to ask on day 2 of our 4 day stay to have them refresh the toilettries, etc. The breakfast was wonderful and well worth the E14. We loved the location, the room was supersmall, very nicely decorated, with a dissappointing mattress. All of the staff were nice except the night shift man. We loved the neighborhood. We moved after 4 days to a great place in 1st Arr. for one half the cost and 3 times the room size where we were overall much more comfortable. Given the other options for the price, I am unable to recommend this place to my friends and family. Also I was dissappointed by the rigidity of management to not honor the price change.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful and friendly staff, clean and well-kept rooms.”
Reviews.Author: etenness
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. The St. Germain area will be the place we stay over and over when we visit Paris. The restaurants and shops in this area are the best serving the best food. The people in this area were very nice to us, American tourists. The room was great, clean and well kept. It was perfect for the two of us who spent full days seeing Paris. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and more than happy to help us plan our days or dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evans21
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Hotel Odeon, and my first since it had been done up - it's in a fantastic location in St Germain, really easy to get just about anywhere and only 2 minutes from the Metro, which is on a direct line to Gare du Nord, so fantastic if you have come by Eurostar. Staff are very friendly and extremely helpful. Rooms are small, but that is usual for paris - my only criticism is that it would be good to have a shelf by the bed for a drink/book and likewise a shelf in the shower for the soap. We will definitely stay here again when we next visit Paris

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel...perfect”
Reviews.Author: ObjectiveReviewer2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, stylish, charming...just simply perfect and very Parisian. My husband and I are beyond surprised how lovely this hotel has turned out to be. We have traveled around the world and every hotel website seems to publish pictures nicer than reality...not this hotel...it is exactly if not better to see in person (I've posted pictures, but they do not do justice to the beautiful wood paneling, exposed ceiling beams, and glass tile in the bathroom). Also the location is high-end and central, however because the hotel has double paned windows the rooms are wonderfully quiet. We look forward to returning as this is the only hotel we will now stay while visiting Paris (this is saying a lot because we generally enjoy experiencing new hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien -Merci”
Reviews.Author: Rowanbush
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights for my husband's 40th birthday and the hotel was everything we hoped for. Great location, friendly & helpful staff, lush decor. We were allocated room 31 which overlooks a small central courtyard - lovely and quiet. The room was lovely and quite a good size by Paris standards, the shower room was a bit small but still nicely done. The one thing that could be improved upon is the number of coat hangers provided i.e. 3, which for two people (one of whom packed too much :) ) staying 4 nights - is not enough. Overall an excellent hotel which really lives up its reputation

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff and charming surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: D_B_MArizona
Reviews.Content: We loved every cozy minute in our room at Hotel Odeon St. Germaine. The neighborhood is quiet but within two blocks you are immersed in the live of the true Parisians. The metro was close and our connection to the rest of the city. The staff at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful in helping with reservations and travel connections.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to keep in mind”
Reviews.Author: EdfromPDR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Odeon St Germain this Easter week for a Paris vacation. We had initially decided to book here after reading that it was a "Best Bet" in a guide book. I also read the reviews that described the rooms as small which is common in Paris. The staff was wonderful, spoke English well and seemed to really want to make our stay pleasant. They had upgraded our room with out us asking. There is a daily buffet style french breakfast but we chose to hit the many bakeries in town. This hotel is in a safe area, close to tourist sites and to the Metro. There are plenty of nearby Cafes to eat at. There are many hotels in Paris but this small hotel with about 27 rooms is very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small and dark room. Very expensive - but good location.”
Reviews.Author: jbassman
Reviews.Content: I was excited after reading the reviews on this site - however please beware that the rooms can be extremely small. Basically a double bed with just enough room to wheel luggage around it. Shower was nice but again very cramped. We found the staff at the hotel to be not the friendliest around either. The only thing going for this hotel is the location. It is extremely convenient to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel conveniently located and great service”
Reviews.Author: Sandw00d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently and quietly situated in St Germain des Pres close to excellent nightlife and some of the key sites of Paris. Notre Dame and the charm of the Isle de la Citie and St Louis are a gentle walk, as are the Jardins de Luxembourg. The Hotel is warm and welcoming and whilst the room was compact, it was charming and comfortable. The service is very courteous and helpful. The Metro (M4) at Odeon is a very short walk and makes access from Gare du Nord (Eurostar) easy and quick, even with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional place”
Reviews.Author: WestportctTravelerct
Reviews.Content: I took my ten year old daughter to Paris and we stayed at the Hotel Odeon for three nights. The location can not be beat, the price was attractive for Paris and the room #5 was comftorable, clean and had a great Parisian feel. I recomend the Hotel for those traveling to Paris. The concierge were very helpful and couteous and were able to help us book a reservation to restaurants and tours. Merci! Andrew & Carly

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as we imagined - a very stylish and well located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dodger67Melbourne
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and also spoke some English. Rooms were small but stylish and clean. A great location for those who want to stay in a very French part of town as opposed to the more touristy part. Very charming street with interesting shops and nearby to the beautiful Luxembourg gardens. Exactly as we imagined it would be.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy Parisian comfort”
Reviews.Author: Shuusen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem hidden in the Odeon area of Paris. Breakfast, with the kind of French bread people dream about, and coffee that really does keep warm, is in a cosy armchair-furnished room.

Reviews.Title: “Chic and friendly hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Barney066
Reviews.Content: This place is great - beautiful interior decoration, chic, luxurious yet, comfortable rooms, lovely area downstairs for drinks and breakfast. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly, and the location is excellent - just a couple of minutes walk from the beautiful Saint Sulpice church and square, with lots of fantastic restaurants nearby, great shopping and the fabulous Luxembourg gardens. I would definitely recommend a stay here and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Yankelthetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Parisian hotel I formally stayed in was renovated, became outrageously expensive, and lost its character. I switched to Hotel Odeon St. Germain and I couldn't have been happier. The place is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in a fanstastic neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MariellaPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: The Odeon Saint-Germain is in a great location --very close to international restaurants, open-air markets, old, historic, and winding streets, and great boutique shopping. It is a pleasant walk to the Louvre and Orsay museums. The staff was exceptional--responsive, friendly and funny (handsome, too). Anyone who has stayed in Paris hotels knows that the hotel rooms will always be small, unless you pay a fortune. The rooms here are typically small (but who wants to spend all day in a hotel room in Paris?), but they are polished, reasonably priced, nicely decorated, and quaint.

Reviews.Title: “Staff extremely helpful, friendly, and service oriented with a very good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: SophieOklahomaCity
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff with good English skills. Excellence service and a delightful breakfast. Room was small although comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, beautiful atmosphere, great location”
Reviews.Author: paintballolive
Reviews.Content: Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain is a cozy, stylish and comfortable hotel in relation to the cost. It well located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, easily accessible to shops and great restaurants. The rooms are not huge, but adequately comfortable for Paris standards. The are beautifully decorated by Jacques Garcia which makes them that much more special. The bathrooms are all newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: perwal
Reviews.Content: Everything about this charming Hotel was top class, the friendly staff, the service, the room, the excellent breakfast, the location. I will definitely be staying in the Hotel Odeon Saint- Germain again !

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GuildfordStargazer
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain is the perfect hotel for business and pleasure. The central location is ideal but what recommends it even more is the hotel itself. The staff are welcoming and friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable and it serves the best breakfast in Paris! I will always choose this hotel whenever I am in Paris, either for work or leisure. Thank you very much for making my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Foody71
Reviews.Content: We had a very warm welcome on our arrival and after booking in were taken to our room which was quiet, clean and comfortable. The hotel is situated in a nice area which is full of small streets with lots of interesting shops and boutiques. Our two nights stay was a very pleasing experience especially the breakfast which had plenty of choices and was of good quality. All in all a really nice hotel which we will certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: queensemiramide
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with good looking an clean rooms. Kind and well informed staff,the location is good in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “delicious...”
Reviews.Author: bibbna
Reviews.Content: I've been for 3 days...the hotle is very nice and they very kind. i suggest to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous place to stay! We will definetly come again ...”
Reviews.Author: paristraveller2009
Reviews.Content: Marvellous place to stay! We will definetly come again ... Small but very nice rooms, located perfectly in the heart of St. Germian des Pres, quiet, very friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: njred364
Reviews.Content: Charming small hotel, located on quiet side street in great 6th Arr. neighborhood, within short walking distance of cafes, bars & nightlife, 2 mins walk to metro, 5 mins walk to Latin Quarter, & Seine. Clean, cozy comfortable rooms with mini-bar & high speed internet. Friendly staff, very helpful with area attractions & dinner reservations. Highly recommended. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteElise
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights in February and was very pleased. The lobby and decor were very cozy and the manager, Matthieu, was extremely helpful with reservations and information. The rooms were decorated nicely, but my one complaint is that the room was very small (I think even by European standards) and very dark. Virtually no light came into the room, which made adjusting to the time change difficult. But otherwise, it was a great experience and I'm sure rooms on the higher floors probably received more light. And you can't beat the location. We were in the heart of the St. Germain district and near a very convenient metro stop and numerous cafes and shops. Definitely within walking distance of the Luxembourg Gardens, Notre-dame, and the Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel de l'Odeon”
Reviews.Author: helenapitter
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of friends (10 in total) have just spent an amazing weekend at the Hotel de l'Odeon in St germain des Pres, Paris. This was the third time I have stayed at this fantastic hotel, but the first since it had been refurbished. The hotel is decorated in such a tasteful way and sets the scene for a fabulous weekend. The hotel , its very stylishly decorated rooms and, of course, the extremely helpful staff all made our stay there such a memorable one for me to celebrate my birthday, and I will be certainly going back for a fourth time

Reviews.Title: “perfect little hotel in the St. Germain des Pres”
Reviews.Author: hetlacup
Reviews.Content: nice little hotel in a great area or paris. friendly staff and nice decor. would definitely stay again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: Pips-E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Paris for his birthday weekend every year. Since we discovered that Saint Germain is the area we absolutely love, we've been scouting out various hotels in the area. Last year we spotted the Hotel L'Odeon Saint Germain and decided to stay there this year, with a couple of friends who joined us. We were not disappointed. Its a boutique hotel, in a great area. The decor has been carefully selected and is really lovely. The staff could not have been more friendly and attentive, and this is definitely a hotel we will be returning to. We are used to Parisian hotel rooms being fairly small, and therefore booked two Superiore rooms, ours was 14, on the top floor and set into the eaves. This is a really lovely and very quiet room with gorgeous soft furnishing, etc. My only critism is that the bathroom, being set into the eaves is quite small - if you're very tall (which my husband and I aren't) this might be a problem. Room 11 which our friends had was larger and more suitable to tall people (which our friends are!!!). That said, its by no means pokey for a Parisian room, and we had no complaints at all. There's some fabulous eateries and shopping in very short walking distance - I'd highly recommend the Boucherie Rouliere, for the most amazing Cote de Boef I've had in a long time! So ... we can't wait to return to Paris next October and will definitely be staying at the Hotel L'Odeon!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic, discreet and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: redsandyboy
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Hotel Odeon Saint-Germain I had the type of expectations that come when you pay top dollar! My partner and I were not disappointed. From the moment I arrived I felt relaxed and in safe hands - the case was whisked off to the room, the room admin done with minimal fuss and at a leisurely pace. The room was beautiful. Real attention to detail over the bedding and textiles in room, the bathroom fittings and were top notch and pretty big by Paris standards, minibar, digital safe, heater/aircon and a great flat screen TV with BBC, CNN etc so that you can watch the world's banking system collapse before you go out and put it all in perspective with a trip to the local pattiserie! On our first morning we went out for breakfast to Paul's pattiserie and cafe but on the second we paid for the breakfast at the hotel. We were not disappointed. We probably paid around the same as the previous day, but this was a far mor generous and leisurely help- yourself continental breakfast. Again, there is always a member of staff to hand should you need anything else, more coffee etc and lots of international newspapers and magazines if you really want to take your time before you hit the sites once again. Our flight home was an evening one and we left our luggage with reception with total confidence. My partner and I have pretty hectic jobs which demand too much of our time. We went to Paris to switch off and spend some quality time together. Attention to detail at the Odeon Saint-Germain enbles you to focus on you and let them worry about the rest. Our stay made two days feel like two weeks. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: achacali
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel, extraordinary location and very helpful staff. Lovely to stroll around the area in the evening deciding where to eat dinner. I would highly recommend it to my friends. Booked at ww.eurobookings.com

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, good location & lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: irishdancer65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2008. We booked the "suite" which was small but quirky. We knew not to expect spacious rooms in the centre of Paris. The location is perfect - lovely to stroll around the area in the evening deciding where to eat dinner! The hotel was clean, modern and staff friendly. The breakfast was good and the rooms themselves thoughtfully furnished. Would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Chic in Paris, Super!”
Reviews.Author: VJCAuckland
Reviews.Content: Initially I was put off by the price, but as soon as we arrived I ceased to worry as the charming reception area, with its roaring fire and comfy chairs, combined with informal reception desk placed this hotel squarely in the chic, boutique and tourist friendly spectrum. This was re-inforced almost as soon as we had checked in and my husband realised he has left his cellphone in the taxi! The staff pulled too immediately, calling the phone(in international toll call) and persuading the driver to come back and reunite us with the phone! What luck! A lot has been said here about the rooms being small. They are, but in Paris, in Saint Germain- they as good as you can hope for. The decor is heavy drapery and brought to mind a gorgeous post war baroque-revival era, though it is all beautiful and new of course. We loved it, and the bed was a good size for us tall people and a dream to sleep on. The bath was a nice surprise, and a door on the WC a bonus. The amenities were very French-top quality silky soap. Its the little things that count. You can tell that great care has been taken with the room fitout, and we appreciated it. Our view of the courtyard, and real Parisian apartments a bonus. Off to dinner the first night and the hotel recommendation was Le Procope, the oldest cafe in Paris where revolutionaries plotted. Again Staff went above and beyond, escorting us to the door, as one of the receptionists was on her way home and was going that way. The location of the hotel is superb. There is a metro just around the corner, there are a myriad cafes, restaurants, a little shopping mall not to mention fabulous boutique shopping all within 5 mins of the door. Slightly further afield is the Seine and the Louvre. We basically walked everywhere from here, its such a vibrant part of Paris. All in all, staying in the heart of Paris, in a hotel which is charming, with staff who are helpful and friendly-really you cannot ask for a better Welcome. Would stay again in a hearbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great authentic French hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kboyce25
Reviews.Content: I am very glad we stayed at this hotel. It is centrally located and in a great neighborhood. There are a lot of restaurants, bars, shops, and movie theaters right down the street. It is also close to a metro stop. Even though the rooms are smaller that most U.S. hotels, the atmoshpere was great and the decor was very French. There is a breakfast served evey morning, but it cost $$. The staff is friendly, always willing to help and speak English. They even offered to upgrade our room at no charge. I would definetly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
